Reviews.Title: “Hotel located in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AA21
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at this hotel, I previously stayed here in 2007 and 2008. It looks exactly the same since our last stay, except they now have wifi available. The hotel is kind of looking shabby and needs a little bit of work and a possible upgrade to the tv's they have in their rooms. We stayed in a double non-smoking room on the 28th floor. There was a really weird smell in our room and it did bother me, but I was just too tired after a 11 hour flight to complain to the reception. The smell did kind of dissapear after the second night. The room itself is a decent size and the bed and pillow are really comfortable. Overall the hotel is cheap, very basic and located in an amazing location. The location was the main reason for choosing this hotel again. If you want a cheap, basic hotel in an amazing location I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “It's Alright”
Reviews.Author: Michelle808
Reviews.Content: Convenience & a comfy bed is what you pay for. Breakfast was pretty sub standard/uneventful, rooms were okay, but not great. Been to alot of Holidays Inns around the world & what you can rely on is the beds are always comfy, but everything else is questionable. For the Holiday Inn Causeway Bay I think they can work on better layouts for the bathrooms, add more amenities w/ soaps/creams, more counter space, better TV's ...Overall for the same price range & just a good of access to amenities I would rather suggest the Novotel Nathan Rd. in Kowloon. Being a Gold/Intercontinental Amb sometimes you gotta change it up for better value, and sorry to say but this one is at a bit of a loss.

Reviews.Title: “Excelllent location”
Reviews.Author: Zjipper
Reviews.Content: Good location just next to Times Square wich has one of MTR subway exit, so it is very convenience to commute. Glad that I got connecting room with sofa bed, non smoking room. Packages Breakfast, asian, continental, american breakfast. Not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for HK budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: lockey1979
Reviews.Content: Would not have chosen this hotel but got duped into it on an Expedia '4* lucky dip'. Good location (behind Times Square Mall) and for a budget hotel it is adequate. Travelled as a family (2 adults and 3 children) and had one of the few large rooms, which are basically the disabled access rooms. It was OK for a short stopover. Breakfast was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: ReuvenM
Reviews.Content: Been here many times, where my top feature I was looking for is center location in the Honk Kong island. Situated behind the Time Square building, this hotel location is dead central, also in the evening where other city locations are deserted. Easy access to transportation Including MTR (Causeway Bay staton), to all the great shopping areas surrounding (which open until midnight), food and restaurants are at large. The time Square is a huge shopping mall, where at the underground there is a decent food court and amazing supermarket with all stuff from around the world. The hotel has great service and city rooms which are adequate and clean. you have a choice of in room WIFI or computers room in the lobby, all free of charge. Breakfast is skippable as it's served from 4 pre-made menu choices and less than you were expecting, so jump in to a nearest coffee shop for better tasting coffee and a snake. You can pre order a shuttle to the airport, which is mostly on time, fast and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: arthursiew
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express is a good property for the ease and simplicity it offers. By what do I mean by ease and simplicity? First off, the hotel is conveniently located in Causeway Bay. It is right next to Times Square. However, accessing the hotel by taxi can be a pain when entering Sharp Street. It's always blocked by heavy traffic since it's a one-way street. The hotel is also very simple, because of the smartly-designed rooms. If you're traveling with companions, the bathroom allows you to have one person shower and use the toilet at the same time with some privacy. The sofa can also turn into a bed. The hotel also offers a lot of free benefits such as internet and breakfast. The breakfast was nothing special, but it will fill you up. They offer 5 different breakfast sets ranging from local to Western food. The Holiday Inn Express will not disappoint you if you are looking for simple place to stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Sean L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holiday Inn Express HK July 2012. Generally good value for money with great location across the road from Times Square shopping centre. Even if shopping is not your thing there are food markets a few streets away and a couple of streets away are late night restaurants (on the opposite side of Times Square, two streets away) which is a five minute walk, and the quality of food is excellent with seafood restaurants, run of the mill chinese restaurants and a nice Vietnamese restaurant all reasonably priced. The area itself being Causeway Bay is not really local like say Mongkok is but it offers enough local flavour to make it interesting with very small vendors as well as the more familiar names and even high end fashions (in Times Square). There are other shopping nearby such as Toys R'Us, Sogo, Swatch etc Times Square offers everything from Marks & Spencer right up to the more expensive chains. Staff at the hotel will give you a map and show you where other shopping is or help you with what you're searching for. Getting to the hotel was a bit of a task as we used a bus from the airport. I would recommend just catching a taxi as carrying bags from half a km away with heavy bags (and toddler) and Causeway Bay's narrow and busy footpaths when you don't know where you're going is very difficult. About $320HKD between the airport and hotel. Bus was $40HKD per person. Also MTR (train) is close by the hotel but can get very busy, and the escalator broke down which made it extremely difficult carrying heavy bags and baby stroller. MTR at the right times can be a good and cheap way to travel. Good thing about the hotel is you can easily catch taxis even though there is a long queue for taxis outside Times Square. The hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about the area, where to buy things and even other areas. Knowledge of english was very good. Room itself was ok. Size was fine. The sofa bed was a bit dirty and there was no spare sheets or blankets for it. The main bed which was queen size was a bit firm and so too were the pillows. The bathroom was nice enough but it really needed it's grout cleaned properly. View was of the streets which actually was good because I could see there was a fresh market nearby (live fish, live frogs, fruit etc) which was very interesting. The hotel itself had a few restaurants and we tried the Japanese Ousen restaurant which seemed quite reasonable on prices (compared to Australia) and service was good, even with our mischievous toddler. Actually all the prices compared to Australia were good - food, alcohol etc. There is a dessert restaurant on ground floor which was extremely popular with the locals - there were queues every night until they closed at 12.30am in the morning. The free breakfast offered was quite ordinary (and I didn't bother about it the last few mornings - went out for dim sum), however the staff were very friendly especially when it came to my toddler. You had a few choices and things on offer were burgers, cornflakes, instant noodles, friend noodles, croissant/ham/scrambled eggs, fruit and a few other things I forget. Yes, I would stay there again as it was close to everything and generally good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jianz
Reviews.Content: Was here for a night's stay after dropping by HK from SZ. Checking in took quite a while as the counters looked understaffed. After the waiting, was informed by counter staff that the room will need another 30 minutes before it is ready and by the time I got my room, it was already close to 3 plus in the afternoon. Room wise, it's really a normal room with nothing to shout about. A tiny CRT television at one corner of the room, in front of the bed. Two problem with such an arrangement; firstly, which hotel in this era still uses a CRT TV? I mean the TV certainly serves its purpose but the screen is a tad tiny for my liking (I think it was like a 14" or max 21"). Secondly, the sofa bed which acts as a couch is 180 degrees from the TV and we all know that CRT TVs can't swivel! Condition of the toilet is average; rather clean, basic amenities were there but the whole toilet was a tad small. Looks like all Holiday Inn rooms are designed in this manner. The biggest problem was with the cleaniness of the room. When I switched on the hair dryer and accidentally directed it to the carpet, the wind from the dryer brought up a whole pool of dust. I was like huh! Overall, I feel that this is a decent hotel, close to shopping mall and MTR, but the overall service level and cleaniness of the entire place needs to be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: RainManPL
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst IHG hotel I ever stayed. It is a very basic hotel with not much services to offer. Just like the name "express" and they do mean it. Everything you can expect is just express. Fast check in. Fast breakfast. Room is very bare but clean and importantly no odor. No view, no flat screen TV, very basic amenities and with all-in-one shower gel dispenser. Room rate does come with a set breakfast, but the restaurant is operated independently by outsider. Service is fast but don't expect anything more. Besides the fact that my room is upgraded, but there is nothing to shout about. The only thing good about the hotel is it's strategic location, just behind Times Square. Staff attitude are not bad. With the price range, I could have a better choice of hotels which are better and equally strategic in location.

Reviews.Title: “It's an Inn”
Reviews.Author: goldie75_57
Reviews.Content: I found this Inn when searching for an alternative hotel in Hong Kong a long time ago and since then I always stay at this Inn. The service in the reception desk is quick and courteous, the rooms that I had are all spick and span. Although, through the years some furnitures do suffer from wear and tear but they are quick to please by changing the furniture within the day. There are no frills but the room but have all the necessities either for business or leisure at your desk, the bathroom is unique because the bathroom door doubles up for the water closet enclosure. Aside from being happy and contented with the Inn, the location is great to boot, the MTR is just a 3 to 5 minutes walk, restaurants abound from $ to $$$$$ dining experience and my favorite is a hole in the wall restaurant that serves roast duck over rice and just a stone throw away from the Inn, if you wake a early and looking for fresh baked breads and or fresh squeezed fruits and vegetable smoothie no sweat, it's just another stone throw away. Shopping for quality goods is just a across the street where Times Square is located and cross another small street jewelries and watches galore, money changer is just near too that gives good rate for a US dollars. Oh just a small hitch, this Inn is not accessible by the free shuttle bus service provided by Airport Express Train, your choice are either take the MTR to the Inn, a long walk I dare say and with your bags in tow would be a major inconvenience on your part, I suggest take a taxi to the hotel won't cause you more than 30 to 40 HKD.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Imee L
Reviews.Content: PROS: - Literally steps from Times Square Mall & Causeway Bay MRT - few convenient stores around so snacks and water runs wont be hard - FREE ( Fast) WIFI IN THE ROOM!!!! - Foldaway sofa so there's an extra bed if there is more than 2 in one room. - Delicious dessert place on the ground floor of the hotel - Kind and accommodating staff - Clean room and working air conditioner. ( This is important because I went when it was summer in Hong Kong and the heat can be excruciating) - Free (2) bottle of water every morning refilled by the staff - Fast checkout CONS - No bell boy to assist you down the escalator to get to the ground floor. So if you have a ton of luggage, this might be a problem -The lobby didn't have any air conditioner so when I was waiting for my sisters sometimes it got kinda irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kmcoyle
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express was just fine for our quick, overnight stay. Location right by the metro and Times Square mall was great. Rooms were small but clean. The facility seemed somewhat dated with dark corridors, but OK. The wireless internet had a good signal and the view from the room showed lots of sky and a good view of the city area. The room was far enough up from the hustle and bustle of the busy streets to be very quiet. The included breakfast was fair -- not great, but OK. Only real complaint: The usual amenities were "skimpy" -- I really prefer a bar of soap and small shampoo. The on-the-wall liquid stuff is just tacky. And the "Bath gel-shampoo" combo was just cheap. The towels were rather well worn and dingy. However, we were provided pillowed labeled "soft" vs "firm" which was rather cool (though we could not really tell the difference).

Reviews.Title: “clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: btonboz
Reviews.Content: Centrally located to all sites, and shopping, the hotel is clean and comfortable, with modern rooms, and ideal for a weekend stopover. The breakfast is poor, like a school canteen, very little european choice, but good choice if your asian, no outside noise, but noisy plumbing from other rooms, even on the 27th floor

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: bpdogs
Reviews.Content: Some people have said this hotel is a value. I disagree. There are plenty of hotels in this quality range for much less money. The only reason I stayed here was because I used Priority Club points and paid nothing. The location is perfect being across the street from Tims Square and next to the MRT. The room is small but manageable. No flat screen TV and too few international channels though. I also found the bed a little to firm, but nice pillows. Everything was very clean and the climate control worked perfectly. The breakfast has a selection of small but ok set meals, but the service is really bad. HI contracts the breakfast out to a restaurant that has overworked and chaotic servers. What's really nice about Express' is the free computer room so I don't have to bring mine. This Express has 6 computers, so there was never a wait to use one. Lastly, the English of most of the front desk is not very good. I expect that in mainland China, but not Hong Kong. They were friendly thought and always seemed hardworking. I was very happy that I was able to get a 6pm late check-out because I am a Platinum member. I am allowed till 4pm and offered to pay for the extra 2 hours, but they waived desk manager waived any charges. So in conclusion, a nice hotel but not for me, not for the price which would have been about $130 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Few days in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Al E
Reviews.Content: Sufficient on all levels. Small room but it is typical for space cramped hong kong. Restaurant was good but the set menu was different from other holiday inns that have a breakfast buffet. Apparently they don't control the restaurants. Great few days overall. Service was good and the area is a busy area next to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are very compact, they shared our purpose of only using it to sleep in as we were out most of the time. Centrally located to the shopping area of Causway Bay and only a two minute walk from the Magnificent Times Square shopping mall which also has the MTR run in to it. Breakfast was a bit chaotic. Reception staff were absolutely great. Free Wi Fi in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Mtr and shopping”
Reviews.Author: Roger T
Reviews.Content: It was even closer to an Mtr entrance than I knew for a while, since there is an entrance in the shopping mall right across the street. Eat breakfast early to avoid crowds and the satay soup had more flavor at 8:00am than the watered down version at 10:00am.

Reviews.Title: “Dusty old rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jmaysu
Reviews.Content: I recently returned to the holiday Inn Hong Kong, having stayed a night or two there two years ago. I'm not sure if it was the room we were put in but, let's just say it was completely different from the way I imagined the HI last. Dusty, musty smelling it was far from luxurious. Although the Causeaway Bay location was what we were after. Lane Crawford and all the shops in Times Square literally metres away from our room, making it the perfect place to stay if you are happy to scrimp and save on accommodation and splurge on designer clothes- habitable for two nights at the most.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice service, big room in HK”
Reviews.Author: Demon D
Reviews.Content: in comparison, the room is quite big in HK. Location is very good, just right behind times square, next to metro station, convenience for shopping and food. Service is very good and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value for money”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaF
Reviews.Content: I am not a Holiday Inn fan, but usually stay at the Holiday Inn chains whenever travel overseas for the values. The Causeway Bay HI Express can accommodate our family (with two teens) without sacrificing our comfortable. Besides the location, clean room and complimentary breakfast which have been mentioned hundred times in the previous reviews, their friendly staffs provide unbeatable service. They email me the multiple transportation options from airport to the hotel before my trip and provide the assistance during my stay. They suggest me to make local calls at the business center to avoid charge, pass me the note from my friend when I check in, keep the stuff for my friend to pick up while we did the sight seeing. Best to mention, Cong-Sao Dessert at the ground level is one of the best in Hong Kong. We don't need to wait a long line for seat in, we can get a to-go and enjoy at our room with the beautiful city view. I will definitely stay at this hotel for our next Hong Kong trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Express, Centrally Located, Fast Food Restaurant Style Service”
Reviews.Author: mriguana
Reviews.Content: An above average HIExpress located smack dab in the middle of the Causeway Bay, it's a perfect spot for shopaholics who want to hit the stores, head back to the hotel to drop off shopping bags and head out for another round. The hotel packs a lot in a small footprint. The rooms are smallish but not tiny by Hong Kong standards, although the bathrooms are cruise-ship sized. There is also a Japanese restaurant and a VERY popular Cantonese place on the ground floor (forget about getting a table at peak times). I enjoyed the breakfast where you are given a choice of 4 different set meals for different tastes. Very clever idea, I wonder why more hotels don't have this option. Only criticism: the front desk is manned by the most inept group I have found in some time. Young men with bad hair cuts and vacant eyes, you half expect them to ask "do you want fries with that?" They're harmless and seem eager to please, but mostly provide comedy relief when trying to complete the most basic tasks. Still, I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: J G
Reviews.Content: Well, for the price, there's really nothing to complain about although the room is really simple and almost everything at average. The location is superb, just a minute's walk to the shopping center Times Square and also the subway. There's also a wet market nearby where you can see all kinds of foodstuff. The dessert shop at the first floor is also awesome, with long queue every day after 6pm (make sure you go grab yours before 6pm if you hate the long queue). The stay also comes with free breakfast and free wireless. The breakfast is a fixed set menu and you only have 5 kinds to choose from. Not really good but not so bad too. But hey, if you don't like it, just walk outside and go to any nearby noodle shop etc. The service is above average. The room could be a bit stuffy if you are used to staying at those 5-star hotels :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sharon N
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 9 days during the Christmas/New Year holidays, and the Causeway Bay location is amazing. Right next to Times Square, where there is an MRT station, surrounded by food and shopping. There's also an amazing little dessert place just on the ground floor of the hotel building - there's always a super long line of people waiting for seats every time I walk past it, even at midnight! The rooms were simple but clean, though a little on the expensive side for something that is not so fancy (it was the peak holiday season when I stayed). Anyhow, the convenience of the location makes it all worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ardeshir46
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just behind Times Square with easy access to MTR. Breakfast is included which is a set menu of 5 different types of food. Every week the contents of the menu are changed.Good room service with friendly staff always willing to help out. There are also restaurants to eat but the best is the desert served on the groung floor.They offer a 10% discount if you are staying in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Smelling Hotel Lobby & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mlacsamana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect! Located beside the famous shopping mall in Causeway bay, Times Square. It's literally a few steps away from the mall and the Causeway bay Station MTR is absolutely near. There are various shopping stalls around, Mc Donald's is near, there's a money changer in front of Times Square. Beside it are lots of food stalls, must-try! Room was spacious, bathroom is clean. No swimming pool by the way, but you won't need one since Hongkong has a lot of attractions to offer. Free breakfast was great! Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Andreas B
Reviews.Content: A very nice and quiet hotel in a very noisy area. Across the street from Times Square, a huge shopping center and also a big metro station. Conveniently located for everything, whether on a business trip or a private visit. Good restaurants and breakfast. Note that the french restaurant (6th floor) is remarkable, both on price and service. Really a must.

Reviews.Title: “Early birds, not necessarily gets the worms!”
Reviews.Author: Ken N
Reviews.Content: I guess most of the travelers already mentioned about how close this hotel next to Time Square and Causeway Bay area, it's so close that you do not need to travel to other parts of Hong Kong! As I did the advanced booking, all i need is my passport and the access cards are given right away. (less than 5 mins). Went up to the room on level 22, looks decent, don't expect much as this is the express type. Clean room with amenity. Breakfast and Internet is complimentary, anyway, the price is already included I guess. Internet is super fast be it cable or wireless. If you need to do some laundry, try it at level 11 (if not mistaken), where you need to slot in coins. Also available is ironing board and iron. Breakfast is set menu consist porridge, eggs with croissants, Indonesian fried noodles, burgers etc that comes with coffee and orange juices. Don't expect good quality food here, just enough for you to stay your day. One thing I don't like is their Internet booking which I booked directly from ihg.com website. This is a getaway for my wife and me. I booked this hotel on Apr 4, 2012 with a price of HKD6,336 for 5 nights on May 1- 6. On Apr 29, 2012, I checked the price again in www.hotels.com, the price was HKD5,544! so I could potentially save HKD792! Made a complaint to both IHG and the Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay, apparently, the reason given is due to demand and supply! so that means, even if you booked earlier, those booked later can save much more! Will I come back to this hotel? Maybe....don't expect all the perks and goodies from a full fledged hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, compact but Clean”
Reviews.Author: DaveLB
Reviews.Content: This past trip to H.K I again stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Causewaybay. Although the hotel is compact it has been a great bargin given its location. The metro is in easy walking distance in Time Square. Also, within easy walking distance are high end shopping as well as local shops. The breakfast offered is limited by the Alpha Choices but being included in your daily rate is good enough to get you going in the morning. The staff is always friendly and courteous. No views except for office buildings and maybe a peek aboo view of the HK harbor depending on the room. But all in all very good.

Reviews.Title: “good if you want to be in the heart of the shopping district”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: I'm here with colleages for a convention at the convention center. They stayed at The Harbour View, I stayed here. This hotel is right in the heart of all the shopping and hussle and bussle, but no outside cafe's or nice harbour views like their hotel. The two hotels are a 20 minute walk ( it's very warm and humid so the walks aren't pleasent) /10 minute $5 usd cab ride appart. I have no complaints at all about this hotel , the service is good, the free breakfast is also good, and the room is fairly large, quiet and with no problems so if you are going to come to Hong Kong your choice is the location to stay , if you want this location this hotel is a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: RA20
Reviews.Content: Visited HK in Nov '11 and stayed at this hotel. Decent property, Rooms are good, Clean. Had a comfortable stay. Room size is good for HK standards and a normal room has place for an extra bed. The USP of the hotel is the Location. Located on Times Square. The MTR (Metro) Station is right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: jkat26srn
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from spending two weeks in Hong Kong on business. Most of my colleagues that have been to HK on business have stayed at the Crowne Plaza but I can't complain about my stay at the HI at all. The room and bathroom were clean (and serviced every day). The bed was very comfortable with choice of pillows - soft/hard. They had a good system whereby your sheets would only be changed when you asked (which I did once) by placing a card on the bed. The reception staff all spoke excellent english (I feel I should apologise here because we Brits are so lazy when it comes to even attempting a foreign language) which was a great help when you went to them with a query. They have an internet room that is only for guests of the hotel. It has six pcs in it and four telephones. Access to the internet is free (at the time of writing this review) and the 'phones don't go through the hotel exchange so can be used with a 'phone card. A free breakfast is provided in the HiPot restaurant located on the second floor of the hotel. (It's worthwile going to this restaurant for lunch/dinner as the food's good and very cheap.) The selection is reasonably good and I had no complaints about it but it is basic so don't go in expecting the Ritz! My room didn't have much of a view - I looked onto the back of Times Square but, in my opinion, you don't go to Hong Kong (whether on business or pleasure) to spend time in your hotel room. The hotel's really central and there are some great eateries in and around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: backload
Reviews.Content: We stayed this hotel for 5 nights in April. The best aspect of the hotel is convenient location. It is about 5 min to walk from Causeway Bay station A exit, which is located at underground of Times Square. The tram stops are about 3 min away, and the bus stop to South is also about 3 min to walk. It can be a little bit quicker if you are used to crossing busy road. There are lots of restaurants and shops around. We especially liked the dessert restaurant at the ground floor of the hotel. It is so popular that a long line of people wait to get a seat every night. We went there every day, and you get 10% discount when you show them your room card. The room wasn’t that big but is functional enough. Internet is free, and there is a nice comfortable chair for deskwork. The beds were OK to sleep, but the sofa bed was a bit old and uncomfortable to sit. Every time we sit, the mattress moved sideways slightly, and we had to keep pushing back. They provide complimentary drinks including bottled water and replenish daily. We didn’t have any issue with the cleanness of the room. There isn’t ironing equipment in the room, but they set up an ironing room on level 11, and you can watch TV while you are ironing. I could understand why everyone complaining about breakfast. You had 6 choices of set menu to choose from. They were nothing special and same every day. They were also more likely to be lukewarm than hot. Still we ate there every morning. We had nice lunch elsewhere, and having so so breakfast didn’t bother us much. We didn’t have any problem with the staff apart from our housekeeping lady didn’t speak English. They were polite and helpful when I asked some information. Overall it met our purpose, and we are happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location for shopper”
Reviews.Author: ferachan
Reviews.Content: the hotel is basic and small but very convenient for shopping and eating. stay with my hubby for 3 nights and do shopping a lot.

Reviews.Title: “I like this place”
Reviews.Author: libica
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I visit Hong Kong and the location is very good. You can take an airport express to Hong Kong station and get a cab (which will cost you around HK$ 50 with luggage) or get the underground (which is HK$ 5 but only to be recommended if you don't have much luggage - Causeway Bay station is huge and it is a long way uphill to the exit), a taxi from the airport to the Hotel will set you back around HK$ 320 and I really wouldn't recommend it, the train is much faster - hop on to the train at the airport and buy your ticket once you are at your destination station. The rooms are really quite big (especially in comparison to Japan) and are basic but usually quite clean. The internet is free, I have never bothered with the free breakfast, so cannot comment but there is a Starbucks in Times Square, should you need an early morning caffeine fix. The Hotel is always full, many Mainland-China visitors, so it is best to book early. I find accomodation in Hong Kong very expensive, even in comparison to Tokyo, so this hotel represents relative value for money. Reception is always friendly and very efficient, housekeeping is friendly but not so efficient.

Reviews.Title: “basic but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SMJMEX
Reviews.Content: Basic, but clean... great location, wifi included, breakfast also included but pretty basic there as well... but it's to have... small room but it is Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but great for the price”
Reviews.Author: 44WestSide
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Crown Plaza in Causeway Bay but this time is was close to $400.00 USD a night. This is a great alternative at 1/2 the price. Rooms aren't large but they're clean and everything works well and free internet !!!!!! Great spot right across from Times Square shopping center. Only downside is the included breakfast. They shouldn't bother, it's really bad.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel in HK that won't cost you an arm and a leg”
Reviews.Author: Smile888
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got to be the best Holiday Inn Express in the world. In the Priority Club family, it is at the bottom of the totem pole, but you wouldn't have known it from the service, room and the breakfast. = The rooms are very roomy with a good size bathroom. - Great service. Extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgable from desk staff - Good breakfast in a full service restaurant with a variety of choices. They have a good selection for vegans - Extremely convenient location. Close to the MTR stop and lots of shopping and restaurant nearby

Reviews.Title: “Best Price, Best Location in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: John Alexander Q
Reviews.Content: The location of this property is the best thing going for it. It is literally just steps away from the nearest entrance to Times Square, which is through the Lane Crawford department store cosmetics area or through the elevator entrance of Times Square. There is a nice dessert shop at the ground floor of the hotel and you can see the lines forming as early as 7PM. the desserts there are really good. This is my second stay in this hotel and it has aged a bit. Cleanliness has also declined slightly, perhaps due to age? Take note that you cannot use the phone to call locally if you did not remit a deposit with the front desk. This was fine with me at all. Overall, a good hotel, great location and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good value”
Reviews.Author: missriss
Reviews.Content: If you’re looking for luxury, well this isn’t the hotel for you. This is a no frills hotel and quite cheap in comparison to other hotels of the same rating but beats those out due to its location. This hotel is right in the heart of Causeway Bay and literally behind Times Square. You are close to everything. The rooms are a little on the small size but has a big bathroom. You might be a little squashed trying to fit in your luggage if you have more than 1 large suitcase each and a few bags of hand carry. The room rate includes breakfast which is nice to have but the breakfast left a lot of be desired in terms of taste and quality – but a good small snack to have before heading out. I would recommend skipping it and eating out elsewhere since the food in HK is delicious and cheap! Positives: - Good central location, close to trains, buses and shops - Affordable room rate - Breakfast included Negatives: - Slow front desk service - Difficult to get a cab since it’s in the back alley and not many of them come down the street. Best to order a cab or go elsewhere. If trying to get to the airport the hotel can organise a shuttle for you I would definitely stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay - good location”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quite expensive for what it is. Staff are not very helpful and room was ok. Nothing special would probably look for an alternative on my return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: Kaede_L
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time staying here and I am really happy with everything. The room and toilet are big, considering this is HK. I am really particular about bathroom cleanliness and I have zero issue with my room bathroom. All the basic amenities are available (daily replenish), if not u can always ask from the housekeeping. They do provide complimentary drinks daily and I must add that the wifi is stable and extremely fast! Major plus. The bed is clean however the sofa looks dated. My cousin found the sofa bed alright, and she could sleep well. Causeway bay is a good place to explore HK as it is only 2-3 stops away Central and Admiralty stations (main MTR interchange). The hotel is right behind Times Square, a famous dessert place right below our hotel, the famous congee shop is just 1 street away (open till 11pm so is good for supper), and it is behind Percival Street where another famous dessert shop is located. Good place for your tummy. A small 7-11 is just down the street so basically you are well covered and a short 5mins walk bring u a bus interchange. FYI: Hotel to HK station is 42HKD.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: Mehmet G
Reviews.Content: stayed there last year and will stay again in a few months. But not very satisfied. The reason we stay there is because of location & priority club points! the rooms are just ordinary & out of date. The set breakfast is really bad!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: guptamanoj
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 20 days in month of Feb - march 2012. Hotel is centrally located with shopping stores are nearby. For Indian vegetarians , 2 main restaurants are located on walking distance. Only negative thing is set menu for breakfast. Hotel is located adjacent to Time square mall which one of the major malls in the Hong kong. With reference to sleep quality - bed is nice and AC does not make any noise. Had quite comfortable sleep. Hotel staff are warm and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Qonrad G
Reviews.Content: No frills property but clean and one for the business person. But for a couple, it's still very good! Free Internet in the business centre. Located right on the doorstep of Times Square and the MTR station. Wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express is in the heart of HK, right behind Times Square and very convenient to use as a base. For something so central, I think it presents good value. It is a no frills establishment that is clean if not a bit old with it's furnishings and furniture. The included breakfast each morning is actually better than you would expect and the shuttle booking service back to the airport was painless (even if the shuttle was late). As an added bonus, there's also a great desert place downstairs which is very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Amenities”
Reviews.Author: JamesM_11
Reviews.Content: Great location in Times Square, a vibrant area with great shopping and restaurants. Easy access to the subway, just minutes away from everywhere in Hong Kong. Clean, nice rooms of good size for H.K. Reliable free wifi, good shower, in room safe, hair dryer, refrigerator, English or Chinese newspaper and a small couch. Free breakfast that was O.K. but ended up at McDonalds after a couple of days. Very reasonable price for location. Use AAA card for best price. Small lobby but helpful staff. Rooms on highest floors are quiet. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: BenzRana
Reviews.Content: I wanted a hotel in Causeway Bay and was choosing between this and Butterfly on Morrison. We ended up choosing this one because of it's proximity to Times Square. I love Time Square, I love the area around Times Square. There's so many nice shops in the area. Re the hotel I like the fact that there is wifi access in the room, that they have an internet room in case you didnt bring your own, you can also do free local calls in the internet room. Oh the free breakfast that comes with the room is welcoming at least you get to eat a bit but it is nothing to look forward to, although not really trash but just basic food. I am still not sure if this is a better choice over Butterfly on Morrison as I havent been to there. Right now, am actually quite unsure if I will still try it or stick with this hotel since we are really very happy with this one. The dessert place on the ground floor is also a reason for going back here. My last stay was with Jia and I absolutely love the interior albeit the small room but the location of this one is better. There's a reception guy who is so unhelpful, I forgot his name but he is quite chubby, I was asking him to help me charge my extra battery but he didnt seem to want to help and didnt go to any special extent to assist. Ruined the service part for me.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for everything but the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Caesar99
Reviews.Content: I occasionally stay on Holiday Inn Express locations for business travel, mostly overnighters. They are pretty uniformly functional, clean and a good value. I stayed here for four nights and it generally followed the pattern. The hotel was in good repair, the room was clean and efficiently laid out and the price was excellent. This HI Express had some important pluses. First, it was in a great location, right across the street from the Times Square mall which has a food court and a subway station. The subway access is a particular benefit; Hong Kong's subways will get you everywhere and you're never lost as long as you can find a station. This is also a vibrant, crowded part of town with outdoor markets, jewelry stores, local restaurants, bars and coffee houses. Second, it has free wireless and wired internet access. Be aware though that the wireless is a bit weak in spots; in my room I had troubles getting a strong enough signal to use Skype. But if you can use a wired connection, you're golden. Now the reason it didn't get five stars from me. The breakfasts are as little as they could get away with and still call it a breakfast. They apparently contract the breakfast business out to an independently owned restaurant in the hotel, and these people make it pretty clear that you're a burden. Out of the five choices of "set" breakfasts, I was curtly told that I could have a choice of two. The "western", which I chose, consisted of one runny scrambled egg, two tissue-thin slices of cold deli meat that were advertised as ham, and a croissant. No refills on the orange juice. As far as service, the kid who served as a waiter was about as cordial as a prison guard handing out the morning meal. Even so, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, although I'd probably find my own breakfast next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Robert A
Reviews.Content: It seems that you can only book this Hotel through the Priority Club (a loyalty Program for this chain of Hotels). But, it is worth it. The Hotel is situated behind Times Square in Causeway Bay and is a very competitive rate for Hotels in this area. The MTR is under Times Square so getting around is not a problem if you are not satisfied with the huge shopping opportunities in this area. The Hotel has an extremely "clean and efficient" process for checking in and out and the breakfast is a set menu with a choice of Chinese, Western or vegetarian. Buffets are wonderful but this is a very efficient breakfast. Perhaps a "big eater" would be wanting more.The rooms are very adequate, if a little small. I also wonder about the floor plan as the long narrow corridors have a bank of elevators (6) on one side and rooms opposite. My room was at the end of the corridor and away from the elevators but those rooms directly opposite the elevators might have a problem with noise. I think this might be something to be wary of. All in all, it is an extremely cost-efficient Hotel with excellent value. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “On Hongkong Island in the middle of vibrant life”
Reviews.Author: Daydreamer58
Reviews.Content: The hotel is opposite of a huge shopping mall. Entrance is at the second floor. The lobby has more the character of a spacious corridor. The rooms are functional but with all standard amenities. The "Internet-Corner" offers several PCs for free, print-outs are charged. Breakfast is offered on the base of six fixed set-options (no substitutions) in a cafeteria with not much atmosphere. The MRT is 3 minutes away. Airport-Express for two persons is more expensive than a taxi, at least at weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfort...”
Reviews.Author: Andreas T
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, small room but comfort enough for me as traveller. Location is besides of Times Square and middle of shopping area. Easy to get Causeway Bay MTR Station, Tram and Bus Stop to HK Airport. From this hotel, you can reach Hongkong Island very easy and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional location”
Reviews.Author: DimskiDimsum
Reviews.Content: HK airport is VAST. There are enormous distances to be walked, escalators to be taken and a monorail just to get to immigration! However it is all very efficient. Having liaised with a friend who used to live in HK, I bought an Octopus travel card at the airport (unused money refundable at the end of your stay) at took the airport express train (23 minutes) into HK. It is worth getting this card and topping it up as it can be used on pretty much all public transport and also to buy things from vending machines and certain establishments). I had to change at Central (Hong Kong) station to the Island Line to get to Causeway bay. This involved much underground walking. As a person with dodgy knees that don't take kindly to excessive walking, it was a fair distance but manageable. The hotel is a branch of the Holiday Inn hotels but it's an 'Express', so NOT a Holiday Inn as you may know it. No facilities (pool, gym, etc). However it is in an amazing location right in the heart of one of the commercial (ie. shopping!) districts of Hong Kong. The entrance to the hotel faces the back door of the immense Times Square shopping mall which also houses the Causeway Bay subway station. There are innumerable taxis in front of Times Square as well. Therefore access to the rest of Hong Kong couldn't be easier. Be aware however, that there are often vast distances to be walked in the subway network. Given that Hong Kong is actually very small, everything is either high-rise or underground. There are no restaurants belonging to Holiday Inn Express but there are 4 restaurants within the building. Breakfast has been outsourced to one of these and is truly horrible. You're much better going out somewhere to get breakfast. You are presented with a set menu of 4 options (all mostly inedible) and not even any bread. There is a kettle and tea/coffee making equipment in the room. No minibar but has a fridge into which you can put your own stuff if necessary. The staff at reception are helpful and will provide maps and information but they are not 'warm and fluffy'. Warm and fluffy is not readily available in Hong Kong generally although people are generally willing to help and most people speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate value for less”
Reviews.Author: Maitland55
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express in Causeway Bay represents the custom built concept also seen in hotels such as Greenwich, London or Hauptbahnhof (Messe), Frankfurt. First time guests may have difficulty finding the hotel as it remains unconscipicous until being at the door. An unaffiliated restaurant on street level attracts crowds of young people, forming waiting lines on the street side. I have used the hotel for years, fairly regurlarly, despite the fact that no upper tier perks were available. As usual in some Expresses (not all) wifi is free and works. Now, at least in February 2012, the hotel has started offering late checkout for HI top tier guests. The free breakfast is on a set basis. In most cases the order is forgotten though and after a wait someone will ask, what had been ordered - and will say sorry. This morning I counted at least 10 persons working in the breakfast lounge and it all appeared somewhat disorganized. The breakfast menu offers five choices, from western to local. This is ok tough, in comparison with having to line up for a meagre buffet (such as in many European and North American Holiday Inn Express hotels.) A transit tip: The walkway in tunnels from the MTR train to the exit under the Mall is huge. I usually switch to tram in the Admiralty station to avoid the long uphill walk in the tunnels (longer than, say, the comparable tunnel walk at Green Park station in London, if going to the Holiday Inn on Piccadilly.) From the tram stop the walking distance is much less, though on the other side of the Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Best budget hotel with greatest location”
Reviews.Author: inxpekto
Reviews.Content: this is the only international chain budget hotel from the Intercontinental group that is centrally located in the middle of Hong Kong. Yes, you need to drag your bags up, just like the way you drag your luggage at the airport, as long as your luggage has good set of wheels. There're also trolleys readily available if you ask the security man where it is. There's an access by using the handicap pathway in which I find that the hotel should cordially inform the guests instead of wondering around the hotel to locate it. Afterall, this is what basic hospitality is all about. Good points and tips: -receptionists are quite professional and not agitated by demanding guests asking about the whereabouts around the city. Perhaps a visible tour desk will help. -room size is adequate and comfortable for two people. There's a foldable/sleeping sofa for the 3rd person. -free high speed internet but am not sure if it has to do with my paying rate. -good quality bed. Twin bed rooms are always closer to the lift while all other queen size beds are away from the lifts. - clean sheets and good lines and basic toiletries -very centrally located in HKG, Don't expect any views other than the views of the bustling wet market which I find amusing. This is Hong Kong. -hand sanitisers in front of lifts. things that needs the attention: -a lot needs to be done for a better breakfast menu. Perhaps a hot instead of lukewarm coffee, fragrance porridge instead of watery porridge, a slightly better ham and sausages is also good. -do not pursuade the guest to join the Loyalty Programs. -proper eye contact and speak english slowly. Overall impression: Highly recommended it as it has a comfortable living setting. Basic courtersy is observed. Efficient housekeeping if you need more toiletries or water, good highspeed internet. This is m 3rd time time staying here as the location is better than any other 5 star hotels I can think of. because it is closer to the real sights and sounds of the real Hong Kong. Surroundings: There're a condom shops as well as condominium sales office, 7-11 to supermarkets, local coffee shops to Starbucks, side street sales to ultra luxury brands. Yes, you are in the middle of everything. Enjoy Hong Kong:)

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: jonathan62
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this hotel a few times. The location is excellent, right behind Times Square and near the MTR. Rooms are small, but welcome to Hong Kong. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast that is included with the room charge is hardly worth the effort. Limited menu of cold food, weak coffee and awful service. We waited 30 minutes for coffee cups (there was coffee around, but no cups). The in-room wifi was also weak and virtually unusable. If a good location in Causeway Bay is what you need, then this place is fine. Just eat breakfast elsewhere and don't rely too much on the wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2005
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very convenient- across the street is Times Square, an enormous mall with many stores and restaurants as well as a subway stop. Rooms are very functional and a decent size, but be aware that closet is tiny and storage space inadequate. Technology works very well, and the hotel personnel are very helpful and courteous. Agree with all negative comments on breakfast. We ate at the second floor chinese restaurant one night, and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Budget H.K.hotel”
Reviews.Author: nincornwall
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 13 nights in this hotel that is more often used by business men for a 2/3 night stay. Rooms are not large, but are perfectly adequate in a busy city where you only use the room for sleeping in. Freshly decorated with a large, comfortable bed, a settee and a desk with internet access. The bathrooms were lovely, clean and modern with a large shower and a powerful water supply. The hotel entrance at street level is a little off putting, queues form for the local Chinese dessert restaurant and you must take the escalator to the first floor to the reception check-in area. This too is used by the public who can eat at the 4 restaurants located on the first 3 floors. Staff were helpful and friendly and all spoke good English. There are 3 lifts which serve guest rooms only and these are fast and efficient. We were given a room on a smoking floor which smelled, so asked to change - no problem. The corner rooms are slightly larger than the other rooms with duel aspect windows, we were lucky enough to be moved to one of these. The internet room on the first floor provides free internet access to all guests and is well equipped as an office. This hotel is popular with main-land Chinese people who come to H.K. shopping or on business, so most people only stay for a couple of nights. Breakfast in included but is very poor, a choice of congee, noodles, fried vegetables etc: or the English option which was scrambled eggs, usually served cold with a slice of toast or a croissant, plus coffee and an orange juice. We only used our breakfast coupons a few times, but most hotels in H.K. do not include breakfast at all. The hotel is very centrally situated in Times Square and is ideal for the M.T.R. (underground train) which is 2 minutes walk away. For the price we paid (hotels in H.K. are not cheap) I would recommend this hotel, and I would certainly use it again, but don't expect luxury, just a basic, clean, modern hotel with very obliging and helpful staff. We were there during a cold spell (last week) and the hotel has no heating in the bedrooms, but once we turned the air-con off it wasn't too bad, although I did buy some fleecy pyjamas!!

Reviews.Title: “A budget hotel with friendly and courteous staff in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: 0004AGS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2011 with my husband and my 3 and 4 year old daughters. After reading reviews I was not looking forward to my stay, but was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is so well placed for shopping, but was a little tricky to find as the entrance is very small and has a restaurant on the ground floor and you ascend up a set of escalators to find the lobby. The staff were kind and helpful upon check in and throughout our stay. This is a budget hotel, so don't expect gold chandeliers and the most perfect of rooms. The rooms are basically furnished but a reasonable size for what you pay. We had a room with a double bed and a foam sofa bed for my daughters to share. Unfortunately the sheet for my daughters bed had a cigarette burn hole in it but had been laundered. The room was quiet and warm and all of us were able to sleep well. The breakfast at Hi Pot, Hot Pot was Hong Kong efficiency at it's best. You select your meal from a set menu list and have plenty of tea and coffee to drink. My husband thought having a burger for breakfast was funny though. He made a comment about feeling like Elvis. All in all this is a good budget hotel with friendly and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “convenience”
Reviews.Author: chappy69
Reviews.Content: hotel is strategically located. very convenient to move around hongkong.Opposite time square where MTR station is located. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “location is perfect! service sucks.”
Reviews.Author: blueberry88_11
Reviews.Content: it is my first time to stay in this hotel. Upon arrival, you will need to use an escalator going up to the lobby for check in...so If u have a big luggage, it will be quite a struggle for you since there are no staffs to help you out. Checked into the hotel took me 30mins despite being a "priority member" ON A PRIORITY LANE. The check in lady staff seems to be at lost dealing with the fuzzy chinese client in front of me. Clearly, she SHOULD have given the matters to the front desk manager! The room was basic. Nothing fancy. I find the position of the television to be weird because it is placed on the write desk so you have to turn your head far enough to give your neck a cramp. The bed was so-so, the room was large enough. the comfort room is really basic yet clean, not enough space to put my toiletries. the water pressure is good. Check out was a breeze. the only down side was there are no staff to help you pull out your luggage.The security guard can help you catch a cab to airport. basically, what I liked about this hotel are: 1.FREE WIFI (free even in your room!) 2. Location(Times Square is literally just across!) 3. delicious dessert shop on the ground floor! (A MUST TRY! if the queue is long, just order for take out & enjoy it in your room! since the shop is VERY small)

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: jglin
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night here after our 5 nites stay at InterContinental. This is our 2nd time with this hotel. I must say although the room is smaller, there's no bath tub and TV is not even a plasma, I enjoyed my stay here more. The location is superb, just next to Time Square and all the busy shopping streets and centers. Best of all, there's free wifi in the room and free breakfast. The dessert shop on the ground floor of the hotel is a must try. Cheap and nice. Caution for non durian lovers-they serve durian dessert. I love the sago with durian. Yummy. The shop is packed with local youngsters at night.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaThooi
Reviews.Content: I was here back in August 2010 with my 2 girlfriends. The room equipped with 2 single beds and a sofa bed, it was just rght for us, leaving us a little walking space. Hotel prices are soaring in Hong Kong, and I think we landed a pretty good deal for this Hotel. We paid about RM300+ for the room through the IHG friends and family rate. The location of the Hotel is superb as it is located right next to Times Square. We were there for 4 nights, the rooms were cleaned and made up each day. Reception staff was very friendly and helpful, and offered a lot of useful information. There is a computer room in the lobby meant for Hotel guests, with 3 workstation linked to the Internet, this is definitely a plus point for a budget hotel! Breakfast was mediocre, and not much to shout about, and the fact that you are in Hong Kong, there are so many more options out there! I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “its all about the location, everything else is mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: fhdz81
Reviews.Content: if you come here its because you are paying significantly less money than other hotels and because of the location. when you come to hong kong, i guess thats what you care the most as you want to stay where things are going on (close to shopping, metro, etc.) and you want to spend your money on shopping rather than hotels :) taking those things into account, there are not much room to complain: i got what i payed for: nice clean room (yes, super small, but okay for 1 person) . The breakfast was OKAY, and the service was decent. I would stay here again as when i come here, i dont expect to spend any time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: ssg10
Reviews.Content: If you expect The Peninsula hotel or Intercontinental, then probably this is not a kind of hotel that you should stay. But, if you just want a convenient hotel for the top-notch location with clean and decent room, then this is a very good option. It is next to Times Square and at the heart of Causeway Bay in HK island. The shopping and food selections are probably the best in HK island and just a walk away. Basically, if you want to just grab elevator down from your room and hit one of the most happening areas in HK and easily grab elevator back up to take a quick rest before next shopping session, then this hotel is one of the best deals in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel and a fair price, with excellent access to everything.”
Reviews.Author: jimmyjazz1966
Reviews.Content: My room was clean, bright, and larger than average for rooms in Asia. The location is what is really great about this hotel. You are only steps from Times Square, the MTR station, and short walk to the Star Ferry to Kowloon. I have stayed at other more expensive hotels in this area, and the double the price for a room, is not worth the extra two square meters you might get!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: yvonne c
Reviews.Content: Its very well located, next to Times Square, especially for ladies traveller for business like me. It's safe to travel at night, though little traffic outside the hotel but still, relatively safe. Its coveniencely located to all the shopping malls, and taking cab to wan chai is less than 10min. MTR not as far as many pple say so, my 4inches heels can still manage the walk so what say you? Room was consider big as per Hong Kong hotel standards. Trust me. And i was shocked when there's an extra sofa bed! I love the bathroom, one door that connected to both toilet and shower area. Most important, its very clean. Breakfast was not great, but since you in Hong Kong, you must eat breakfast in local cafe. And yes, i will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: babamo
Reviews.Content: very small rooms , 4 seated options for breakfast , i stayed for 2 nights , had a business meeting , the only good thing is the location were 2 min walk to my meeting . never again in this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Good location and halal food”
Reviews.Author: ARMKL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently on 17 Dec. Rooms are small but no complaints.No window viewing, only the wall of Time Square. Small serving for cereals. The number of pedestrians is ok not as crowded as those on Nathan road/Kowloon side. The location is the best part. The MTR train is 5 minutes away below Time Square mall which is opposite the hotel. McDonald is also 5 minutes walk. There are 2 halal restaurant nearby which is also 5 minutes walk it's called Aladdin's mess and Rang Mahal both on first floor of a shop building. Was informed there is an Indonesian halal restaurant but didnt come across it. Generally this hotel is good for tourist on the go in the day and only use the room beds at night to rest the tired feets..

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is...”
Reviews.Author: BBeeps
Reviews.Content: It's a Holiday Inn Express, no different from any other in any big city. Small, basic and that's that. This one has seen a lot of wear and tear and overall feels a bit grimy. Location is very convinient and that really is the best thing I have to say about it. I will not be returning here again, HK is full of better options at this price range or even lower.

Reviews.Title: “Great if not for bad check-in experience...”
Reviews.Author: superbova
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its great location and no-nonsense approach to holiday lodging. It has everything we need i.e. a decent sized, well-equipped bathroom (by Hong Kong's standards), clean and comfortable beds, and relatively quiet rooms. Only thing lacking was ironing facilities in the room. It would have been the perfect choice if not for the bad check-in experience. The counter staff who attended to us was cold and mechanical. We arrived an hour later than the designated check-in time but the rooms were still not ready. There were no apologies or any attempt to make us feel comfortable during the wait. I'd return only if I get a better value on the rooms next time.

Reviews.Title: “Small, near a subway stop for easy access”
Reviews.Author: MarcInSA
Reviews.Content: This was without a doubt our smallest room during a two-week trip, but it was still a pleasant stay. The two twin beds were extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was small but had a good layout. There's also a desk and a small loveseat in the room, but not much extra space for storage or laying out suitcases. It's a quick walk to a subway stop that makes for easy access to anywhere in Hong Kong. We went all over Hong Kong island and Kowloon from our base here, and it's not too difficult to get to the airport by train either. We took taxis to the Victoria Peak tram and some restaurants, but they're inexpensive and easy to find in front of the hotel. For our included breakfast, we could order from among six choices on a fixed menu (try the "Local" option -- the noodle soup dish is surprisingly good). Staff members were nice during our limited contact with them, but as we know our way around the city we didn't need much help on this stay. If you don't mind a cozy room, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for shopping and Happy Valley”
Reviews.Author: Jenz99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Holiday Inn Express to take advantage of its proximity to Happy Valley Racecourse and were satisfied with our stay. The room was small but well equipped with two twin beds, a small couch and a desk area. We were on the 9th floor, and I was pleasantly surprised that we could not hear much noise from the street with the air conditioner running. I could occasionally hear people in the hallway, but it wasn't loud enough to disturb my sleep. Our room included breakfast down at a restaurant on the 3rd floor, which was good but not great. Got a choice between 6 options - a couple American, a couple local and a couple that mixed some of both options. Hotel staff was very friendly, and let us store our bags for several hours so we could enjoy Hong Kong before heading over to Kowloon. The best part of the property was its location, directly across the street from Times Square and a 10 minute walk from Happy Valley. Could easily access the subway in Times Square to reach other parts of the city as well. Plenty of good restaurant options within a couple blocks of the hotel as well. One thing we did find difficult was getting a cab in the rain, which is a problem in any major city. None of the cab drivers wanted to take us over to Kowloon, and the bellman eventually recommended we drag our luggage over to Times Square in the rain and take the subway. Although it saved us some money it was a little convenient, especially since the subway is so crowded and tough to negotiate with bags. Overall a good stay for the value, even with a few issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JadeMaldives
Reviews.Content: Just beside the Times Square, a 7 minutes walk to the mrt and across Nathan road with full of road shops. Love it here, room is very clean but i think it is over priced compared to some other hotels we had stayed in Hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service excellent location in Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: CXM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Located accross the street from the Times Square Mall and building, it is on the Island MTR line, with easy connection to Central and Admiralty metro station. The staff is friendly, the hotel is spotless and has five restaurants on site. If youget the right room, you can see a bit of the bay from your room. Easy access to restaurants, metro, buses and trolleys near Hennesy Street. Don't be afraid to buy a metro pass, as the metro system and bus routes are very easy to figure out. Messaging in the metro are done in Mandarin and English. The Holiday Inn Express offers free high speed internet and morning breakfast at one of the restaurants and they are included in your rate. This is a top pic for me in Hong Kong. If you suffer from claustrophobia, skip Honk Kong all together as a destination.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location not good value”
Reviews.Author: OzFactotum
Reviews.Content: Situated behind Times Square in busy Causeway Bay this is an ideal place to stay for shoppers and sight seers. From the basement of Times Square you can reach the MTR station and get to Central, Admiralty, Tai Koo; or to Tsim Sha Tsui, Jordan and Mong Kok on the Kowloon side smoothly. A light public bus terminal is in Tang Lung St, just north of Times Square. This bus will take you to Stanley Market. Further north is the tram way. Times Square itself is full of shops and restaurants. Designers' shops are all here as well as in Pacific Place (Admiralty) and Tai Koo City Plaza (Tai Koo). More down market shopping are in Jordan and Mong Kok where you will find "Ladies Street" and the electronics' Sai Yeung Choi St. In short you can shop until you drop with the minimal traveling time and can avoid taxis in peak hours. It would be convenient to buy a MTR smart card to be used not only in the MTR but on buses, trams, light public buses and even convenient stores. Trams are always packed and there can be pick pockets. The hotel is expected to be utility basic: probably it expects people to stay not more than one or two days. There is a small wardrobe with hanging space but not drawers or shelves. You will have to live out of the suitcase. There is a safe, CRT TV, an empty fridge, and phone. Free internet is provided downstairs and also via ethernet in the room. Tooth brush with small tooth paste and slippers are provided. The bed is comfortable albeit a bit hard. Linen is changed daily but general cleaning is not up to scratch. The hotel really needs a thorough going over. Bits of black stuff flies out of the air conditioner outlet!!! Avoid smoking floors at all cost. The stench will make you vomit. Laundry service is not cheap but there is a cheaper laundry in Tang Lung St where they do a laundry only (without ironing) cheaply by weight, within a day. Breakfast is provided. There is choice of six, mainly for local diet. However it is good just to go down for a couple of coffee and go elsewhere for real breakfast. There is a McDonald in Russel St opposite Times Square, coffee in their McCafe is good. In this hotel there are lots of people from China coming to do their shopping. They go out daily to the emporium Sogo nearby with suitcases to be filled up. You might have to dodge their suitcases in the lifts and they don't always observe western etiquette.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Efficient Services!”
Reviews.Author: RayL53
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel several times in the last three years. Our most recent stay was in March 2011. We found the staff friendly and courteous. The free stay for children under 17 is a big bonus for families since many hotels in Hong Kong will have a surcharge for the extra child in the amount of approximately $50 canadian per child per night. The breakfast is complimentary with a choice out of three/four set breakfasts which can be Chinese or Western. It certainly is better than the complimentary continental breakfasts offered at most Holiday Inn Express in North America. The pullout sofa bed is adequately comfortable. The location is also conveniently close to Time Square which is a multi-storey mall with fine choices of eateries/restaurants and the subway station is nearby (a 5 minute walk). It is also only a block away from a market where one can buy fresh fruits. Even though the price of stay has gone up quite significantly in the last two years, I still believe that it offers good value. I liked my previous stays enough that I already booked a room for our next stay in February 2012.

Reviews.Title: “No thrill hotel, so so location”
Reviews.Author: FERU06
Reviews.Content: First of all, if your main business in Hong Kong is at the convention and exhibition center, then this hotel is not convenient at all. If you look on the map, it seems pretty close to the convention center but it s not walking distance at all and fetching a taxi during rush hours is close to impossible. On top of this the MRT is just not convenient at all to get there. Otherwise this hotel can do the trick for those touring hong kong especially hong kong island. The reception is fast and efficient, just dont expect any friendliness or smile. The rooms are ok considered the price, small and no thrill but fairly clean which works fine. The bathrooms have been renewed recently so look quite clean as well. Overall rooms are typical no thrill business hotel so dont expect anything fancy but if it s just to spend the night, then it works. Breakfast is included but I would avoid it. You get to choose between different western or chinese set breakfasts, but they are all pretty much horrible. All in all it s not a bad hotel but its location will or will not work for you depending on your business in hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Location Is Everything -- And the Only Thing”
Reviews.Author: stevesomething
Reviews.Content: This property is a bit worn around the edges, but what would you expect? It's a very high-traffic hotel. It's a decent value if you can get it around US$100, but much more than that and you'd be better off somewhere else. The hall carpets were stained and faded. I repeatedly cracked my knees on the absurdly designed desk drawer. The restaurant is abhorrent -- not that it matters all that much, given the fact that you're a stone's throw from some of the best food in the world -- I'm just saying that it would be more advisable to eat the free-breakfast-voucher rather than the food it represents. Then again, the bed was among the most comfortable I've experienced in the Fragrant Harbor, a city with a notorious affinity for rock-hard mattresses. Nice pillows, decent view even from a mid-level floor. Good water pressure. Attentive staff. For Platinum IHG members, late check out was 4pm. So it's OK for what it is, which is a place to sleep while you explore the island. Spend as little time in the room as possible and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: MYCWL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 10 - 13 Nov 2011. Room was in good condition, spacious by HK standards and most importantly, very clean. MTR was just across the road. The breakfast was decent though not the most tasty. Overall, it has been a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “good location, if you plan to spend most of your time on hong kong island.”
Reviews.Author: ckyz
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is really superb. almost directly above the mtr exit, just a 3 mins walk. and best of all, just right at the entrance of the hotel building, they serve desserts that open up till 2am about there. one of the best desserts ive tasted in hong kong. try the durian ones! the room is just basic room, but with small windows as i got a corner one. my sister got a one facing the street and the room look so much brighter. the hotels in hong kong are quite expensive, and very small. if you are planning to spend loads of time on hong kong island, its a good place but if you are just there for shopping and eating in kowloon, i would advise on other cheaper hotels in kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “The Price is Right...”
Reviews.Author: MaximusGT
Reviews.Content: Before writing further details, I'd like to specify - you'll get what you pay for!!! Hotels in Hong Kong are relatively expensive and since I have subsequently stayed at a better and a worse Hotel, I can compare and give a balanced opinion. Holiday Inn Express is a Lower Frill, Value For Money version of Holiday Inn. The location being on Hong Kong Island is good. You get out into Times Square and the Causaway Bay MTR is at a walking Distance making the trip to the business District Stations of Admirality & Central & also the Happening places a 10 min Affair... The rooms are strictly "Mid Sized" and serve a business traveller with 1-2 days in HK well. Staff is smiling & helpful. Ok for short visit at a mid range budget...

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: jordilee6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of it's location and that we needed to fit three people in a room. The price was reasonable and the place was clean. Breakfast was not worth paying for or having it included. bLook elsewhere, for only a little more you can find more a little charm and less hassle than this hotel. I would definitely try another hotel rather than stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kelingyun
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room with two friends. Slept on the coach bed, was comfortable. Service very good. Extremely helpful staff. Location is excellent. Just behind the Times Square Shopping Mall. Will stay there again next time!!

Reviews.Title: “A no-frill hotel with all the conveniences”
Reviews.Author: YVRWu
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this property 2 weeks after it opened and is my hotel of choice whenever I am in HKG. The staff is friendly; rooms spacious, clean and quiet, and the free internet works. It is located in the busiest part of the Island across from Times Square (an upscale local shopping mall) and the Causeway Bay MTR train station and is easily accessible via other types of transportation. A wide variety of restaurants/food can be found around the clock in the neighbourhood. Victoria park and the world renowned Happy Valley Race course are within 10 minutes walk. The breakfast is simple but adquate to kick off the day.

Reviews.Title: “good location and relatively spacy for HK”
Reviews.Author: SAM_TOKYO
Reviews.Content: This hotels locates at a perfect place for shopping and sightseeing for Hong Kong island side. I stayed there for business but could enjoy shopping between work. Also, the room was one of the biggest I have evenr stayed in HK. Staff were friendly and nice, Chinese trourist from mainland always cut in a line but still good quality for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good included breakfast, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gembert
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two friends in February 2011. We were in a two bed room with one on the sofa bed. The rooms weren't particularly large so it was a bit of a squeeze but the main beds were very comfy and the room was made up daily. (Sofa bed was ok so we swapped around a bit!) The bathrooms were particularly nice with complimentary extras shower caps, toothbrushes etc. I think the best part of staying here was being opposite to Times square shopping tower - its an amazing place and we spent many hours there. Also you are really close to the Causeway bay underground station and not far from the trams down Hennessy Road. The little dessert bar at the bottom of the hotel is also a big hit and they were nice enough to give us one free little dessert. I recommend trying something here if you are a bit adventurous but maybe skip the grass jelly! Overally its a great place to stay and I would be happy staying here even if I was a lone traveller except it probably isn't the sort of place where you will get to know other hotel goers.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here during Christmas season”
Reviews.Author: NeilChristopher A
Reviews.Content: The location is the best. It is located a few meters away from the MTR and near the Times Square mall (if you feel like signature clothes shopping). A bit difficult to find because it is sandwiched between buildings and fronting a one-way road. Small reception area. Limited seats for those waiting. If you want to use the comfort room, you got to ask for the keys first as they limit people using the comfort rooms. Rooms are OK. Breakfast - here's the thing about HONGKONG. I've been there 3 times and food has always been a challenge here. Complimentary breakfast isn't buffet style and you only get to select a "combo meal".
