If you can tolerate such set-up, then you are good to go. Front desk is quite helpful especially in giving tips as to where to go to and when is the best time to go. For seasoned travellers or frequent HK flyers who won't mind the price since this is in Hongkong Island, then this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Low standard”
Reviews.Author: JennyGAustralia
Reviews.Content: We only stayed overnight. The location is great and they did allow us to check in early after our long flight so we were grateful for that but that was about it. The room was very ordinary and musky, but clean. Breakfast was shocking. Couldn't drink the coffee and the food was very poor, certainly put us off having a meal there and the service was by grumpy, unhappy staff, probably overworked and under staffed. They let us leave our bags there after checkout which great but on collection we were at the front of the line and they served 3 other couples who spoke Chinese ahead of us. Will definitely look at somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trebs1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location next to Times Square mall. A bit hard to find given small signage (exit from Lane Crawford department store). Clean, basic, no-frills, but gets the job done when you don't spend too much time in the room anyway. Not the nicest bed but comfortable. Fast wifi in the room. Efficient staff that doesn't get in your way. A bit pricey for what you get but have to pay for Causeway Bay location I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel. Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy C
Reviews.Content: Booked here in advance last July at HKD1242 + 10% SC per night only to find out a day before staying in the hotel that the price of the room is down to HKD980 + 10% SC. Complained and showed them a copy of the print-out and immediately got a favorable reply. Arrived around 12 noon and got an early check-in as well. Room is big at around 20-22sqm compared to typical HK room which is between 10-15sqm. Room is clean and cozy, has LCD TV, big bathroom, very comfy beds and pillows as well as free wifi. Location is just across Times Square and 10-15 minutes covered walk to Causeway Bay station. Breakfast is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value. Best Location”
Reviews.Author: pingben
Reviews.Content: - Convenient Location: right next to Time Square at Causeway Bay - Clean and decent sized room for HKG standard - Free breakfast - set menu with 6 selections - not bad - Free internet - Polite and efficient Staff - ~HKD$ 1080 a night - A very popular dessert place downstairs? Didn't try Stayed one night on transit to China, going back to stay a few more nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - lousy food”
Reviews.Author: garyinternational
Reviews.Content: Very noisy but excellent location - horrid breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Most suitable for small families”
Reviews.Author: chiongmaya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 2011 with my family. Hotel is located behind Times Square Mall.You have to have a sharp eye to see the hotel sign. And then took me a while to figure out where the entrance to the hotel was. No bellhop to help you with your luggage. You can either take the escalator or elevator (for bigger luggages) to the lobby which is actually on the2nd floor. Check-in was not quick. Staff not really too cheerful. Serious mode probably. You have to take the correct elevator that servers your floor. Room was okay to say the least. What caught my eye was the 2-seater sofabed. Had I known, I would not have gotten a 2nd room for the kids. Weird toilet door. Free breakfast was ok, but i would rather have the dimsum on the top floor of Lee Plaza nearby. Dont be fooled by claims that the MTR station is just across the street. What is across the street is the ENTRANCE to the MTR station. You'll need at least 10 minutes of walking until you actually get to the train. The walk back from train to hotel is much more tiring because it is sloping upward. I would recommend this hotel to people who'll be in groups of 3 per room or small families with little kids. Business center is beside the lobby, but they charge for printing on a per page basis. No internet inside the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean & fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: AngieCambridge
Reviews.Content: We were only in Hong Kong for 2.5 days so we really needed a well located hotel. The Holiday Inn Causeway Bay was perfect for what we wanted. I am quite fussy when it comes to cleanliness and location, and this hotel ticked both boxes. The room was simple but very clean and bigger than I expected considering the famously small rooms in HK hotels! The hotel is literally opposite the hugh Times Square shopping mall which has an MTR station beneath it - this is the main plus point as shopping in Times Square is just loads of designer stuff that you could get anywhere. There is a computer room in the lobby where you can use the internet for free, you just use your room card to get in. And there's a great chinese dessert place downstairs by the escalators which serve great hot and cold desserts - try the mango milkshake!!! Overall this was a clean hotel with a great location and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Wonderful Location, Friendly Staff, Reliable”
Reviews.Author: SMEMBoston_Ma
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express is in a wonderful location and close to many attractions, public transportation, shopping, and eating establishments. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and exactly what you would expect a Holiday Inn Express to offer. The breakfast is simple and convenient. The internet is fast and reliable. I would book this hotel on my next business or personal visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but basic”
Reviews.Author: DublinBubbles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night enroute from Australia to London. The staff were very helpful and efficient and allowed us use of a room when we arrived early morning which we were very grateful for. We had connecting rooms which were basic but clean. We were very comfortable there and it suited our needs. It is in a great location beside the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great...euh... location”
Reviews.Author: EazyTraveller
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Causeway Bay, this hotel is close to the majority of amenities that may need. The MRT is 50 meters away from the entrance and will take you to any destination that HK has to offer… As for the hotel, well, what you pay for is what you get. Cheap by HK standards, the Holiday Inn will bring you 20 years back, to the days of halls of residence at College…. The paint on the walls is cracked and the colours faded. The staff are friendly and helpful, but generally struggle with English. The rooms are “matchbox size” (small for a couple by any standards) and not very well isolated from the noise in the corridor. Even though the beds are comfortable, they are small and in length and width… Overall, the Holiday Inn is a good place to stay if you are on a budget, if you are looking for something central, intend to spend the night and measure less than 175 cm (i.e. 5ft8), then this place is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “very good location, breakfast is a bonus”
Reviews.Author: pael
Reviews.Content: i like staying here with my partner because we always go to hong kong to shop, eat and walk the whole day. this is an ideal hotel because of its location (across times square mall, near MRT station). breakfast is a bonus too. most hong kong hotels do not offer breakfast with the room rate, so this, albeit set meals (choice of 5 sets), is a good deal. free internet also offered in room and at the business center for guests. i wouldn't recommend it for families with kids though as the rooms are small. some of the facilities may need repair due to wear and tear. our shower leaked but it is not a major inconvenience. all in all a good, no frills, comfortable hotel. i'd stay here again, but will opt for a hotel with bigger rooms (like the park lane, which is not too far away) if i am traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and have stayed before”
Reviews.Author: RHsinga
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on the 2nd floor in Causewaybay shopping area, not far from Wanchai and the national stadium so good location for me....

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, close to Times Square mall in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Ashish S
Reviews.Content: Went with family (wife and 10 year old son) for a vacation in Hong Kong. Selected the Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay for the location and the price. Great value indeed and connection to the Hong Kong metro through the Times Square mall was just perfect. Evenings were great to walk around the neighborhood and go shopping in Jardine's Crescent and other shopping areas nearby. The only drawback was really the limited choice in the breakfast offered at this Hotel. Would advise not taking the breakfast, but otherwise I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great budget hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: sgj70
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Holday Inn Express Causeway, for one night as a trip from Hong Kong. Booked fairly late and still got a reasonable rate. Will point out now, I spend a lot of time in hotels for both business and pleasure. The hotel is located very close to Times Sq and an MTR station, its not the easiest to find initially.. very easy once you have. In that area there are lots of places to eat, shop etc. With easy access to metro, bus and tram lines it’s a great base to explore the island and get into Kowloon. Arrived and room wasn’t quite ready, asked to take a seat. It was also explained that as a frequent stayer I had a free voucher for breakfast, internet and a late check out. After a short wait while I was reading the guide books etc, the receptionist came over with room keys and pointed me to lift. She also helped with question on how to get to a certain location. Very good English, polite and professional. Getting into the room was a small challenge, the slot for the key card is at the bottom of the lock, so you slide it up. A sign explaining this would have helped.. Most hotels are into the top, straight into the slot, or touch etc.. so this was a new one on me!! The room had safety deposit box, fridge, TV, plus I got some complimentary water, and the usual kettle etc. Was pretty clean and with a double bed plus a sofa was spacious (by HK standards) for just me. Wouldn’t have been too small for two. The room itself was comfortable, well appointed for the price, so no complaints on that front. Breakfast was from a set menu, opted for the “American” one, not brilliant but perfectly edible. Location wise, price wise etc couldn’t really fault the stay. Have already told colleagues its worth a stay at that price.... Had all the usual pleasantries on the way out. Staff friendly and efficient. Asked the security guard for directions, he was happy to oblige more than once.. The true test for me is would I stay there with the wife, and too be honest I would. BUT, probably won’t has will shell out on a hotel with a pool or harbour view suite, but there was absolutely nothing wrong with this Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “The best Holiday Inn Express I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: johndfffff
Reviews.Content: As a platinum member of Holiday Inn, I stay at many properties throughout the year. This is by far the best one I have ever stayed at. I love it. Great location and service, and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, no fuss family stay”
Reviews.Author: clooi
Reviews.Content: You can hardly find any other reasonably priced hotel room that can fit a family of 4 in Hong Kong with 1 month advanced booking. First of all, just like most hotel, check-in was relatively quick for on-line self booking. The twin double-beds room was clean and comfortable enough for a short stay The Chinese restaurant in the hotel seems popular and crowded with the locals so advanced booking is recommended. The hotel is not far from Ocean Park and shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in HK”
Reviews.Author: Finke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with total of 5 people in two rooms. Only place in HK that I found with pull-our sofa type rooms that can sleep 3. One of the few place with connecting rooms, and one of the few places in HK that were not blatantly discriminating against families with more the one child. Small rooms for US standards but big for HK, very functional, and clean - all in good working order. Breakfast is basic but included in rate that we had. Very helpful and friendly front desk staff. A pleasant walk from the Star Ferry.

Reviews.Title: “free breakfast was horrible”
Reviews.Author: jamie007az
Reviews.Content: the bad attitude of the staff was only worse than the food...this is a lose .lose situation. the hi pot restauarant that provides breakfast for the hotel victims has such bad staff that they stand no chance of these hotel customers ever coming back later in the day to use the restaurant. holiday inn loses..the hi pot loses and the customer loses. wow...and ive stayed at 30 holiday inn express all over the world...one of them has to be the worst..now i know which one....

Reviews.Title: “Business travel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: TX1969
Reviews.Content: Great place for travelers who are looking for a clean, efficient place in Hong Kong. Bad place for couples on their first romantic trip to Hong Kong. The hotel is located in a smelly alley right behind Hong Kong's premier 'Times Square' shopping center. There is no view from your room; you are looking at a dark stone wall which forms the back of the shopping center. The picture on here is definitely misleading. Yet you are in the middle of town: Right in the heart of the shopping area, many restaurants nearby and so is the Causeway Bay Metro Station. The rooms are small but have everything you desire: Decent bathroom, computer desk, a comfortable bed, fridge, safe and a chair. The hotel even supplies a free travel adapter for your room. Best of all: The rooms are clean with excellent house keeping service. The internet is free and so is the bottled water for your room. There is also a free internet center downstairs close to the front desk. The hotel does not have a bar but 3 restaurants located in the same building. All depends what you are looking for. Considering the room rate, you really can't go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, small, fine service, convenient”
Reviews.Author: VATraveler55
Reviews.Content: As most people are aware, hotels in Hong Kong can be pricey. As a result I decided to try to save a few dollars for the company amd chose the Holiday Inn Express in Causeway bay. It's the most price friendly of the IHG group hotels in Hong Kong, and for one person certainly adequate. For a couple, it would be cramped. The biggest detractor would be the size of the room which was small to the extent that I had to use the chair as a rest for my suitcase. Having said that however, all other aspects of the hotel are fine. The location is superb in causway bay, the bathroom was spotless, bed comfortable, free internet, free decent breakfast, and a decent price for Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't realize how great the location was.”
Reviews.Author: ringinthenewyear
Reviews.Content: It's a fine hotel. I would definitelly recommend it for the following reasons: - easy taxi ride to convention - location is right at times square, top notch shopping available right there if that's important to you. - free breakfast, you get to choose from 5 menu items - restaurants in the hotel are actually good, try the Japanese restaurant for lunch. Quite good! - the dessert shop at the ground level, is crazy popular and I have gotten one everyday that I am here. - friendly staff, although they are so busy I think they should have more front desk people to make things go quicker. - clean nice rooms, excellent house keeping Cons: - no spa - no pool, jacuzzi - no gym Overall, I'm very pleased and would no doubt come back.

Reviews.Title: “For the lesser no-frills travellers”
Reviews.Author: ShahrilHarman
Reviews.Content: It is hard not to compare but I have stayed at the Regal Hotel about 10 minutes walk away in the same area which is not fantastic but it was a true hotel. The Holiday Inn Express does not feel at all like a Holiday Inn. It felt like something for those budget travellers who just needs a place to bunk in after a whole day of sight-seeing. A good no-frills, under the normal price kinda place. My room has a toilet door with no lock, and the door cant even close properly. No issues if you are alone of course. The rooms seemed small and stacked, that you can hear the activities of the next room or even kids running outside your room in the corridor. At a time when most hotels have switched to the LCD TV, the Holiday Inn Express still uses the tube TV. The beds are comfortable but the basics are there. Extras like a comb, shampoo or conditioners, bring your own or buy it at Times Square. They use this one-for-all kind of soap. Its a soap, shampoo and conditioner. So if you are looking for a hotel with frills, this aint the place. No swimming pools, no saunas, no gyms. Internet speed is good ... though there is no WIFI in the rooms, only in the lobby. Breakfast was not suitable for me. You had to call the waiter to order your food from a limited menu. But it is still a comfortable hotel to say the least. The area surrounding it has lots of food places, and shopping. Times Square is right beside it and the Causeway Bay MTR is accessible from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for reasonable price - excelent location”
Reviews.Author: Maxximus99
Reviews.Content: For the price of 80 eur this hotel is awesome...Perfect location..just in the middle of times square.....rooms are nice and spacious..- compraing that you are in Hong Kong.......Breakast could improve, but for that price, you can not expect much.....Overall, good hotel considering the price....

Reviews.Title: “HIE-Nice place, definitely will be back”
Reviews.Author: xyphen
Reviews.Content: First time to Hong Kong for a holiday with my wife and 4 yr old boy. Good experience started even before we went there. My gratitude to Ms Tansie Yeung whom had help arranged a nice, clean room for us after I informed her that we will arrive late in the evening. She has even arranged a sofa bed for my kid, which was great. Limo service recommend by her was also great. Best for people travelling with young kids to avoid the MTR with all your luggage and kids. Travel with comfort with a bit more costs. My wife couldn't believe that Times Square is only 30 feet across from the hotel. Great location for shopping, food etc. It is good for families with young kids as you could always walk back to let your kids rest before another round of shopping and outing. Hotel staff is very helpful with directions and patient with all our first timer queries. All amenities available, shampoo, toothbrush, towels etc and clean. Hotel also has an internet room. Good to check out and plan your trip further if needed. Took the MTR to Disneyland, had a jolly good time and shopped around the hotel area the days after. MTR station in Times Square. Next year, Hysan shopping is coming up as well. My wife can't wait for the next trip. Breakfast is at level 3, with 6 choices. Generally acceptable food. Those who is tired of it can just walk across the other side to the wet market area and get dumpling / wanton noodles, roasted goose/ duck / pork etc. Real convenience. Lunch: Just walk around, loads of choices. Dinner: Check out the Japanese restaurant in the hotel, good food at reasonable pricing. And plenty of other restaurant in Times Square opposite. Plus there is McCafe across Times Square. Also must check out the dessert shop on ground floor of HIE. But please avoid Superstar Seafood in Times Square. Plain Chinese food at exorbitant price, poor service and noisy environment. Street side dumpling noodle and fried rice is way better. Beside, poor experience with Superstar Seafood, the entire holiday has been great for us and are planning the next trip back to HIE.

Reviews.Title: “great loacation!”
Reviews.Author: goramos
Reviews.Content: this small hotel has no frills but very clean. all amenities that you may need is available. staff very friendly and helpful. GREAT LOCATION!!! times square and the mtr is just across the street. yummy dessert bar at the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rene2461
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and 12 year old daughter, who loved the location for the shopping as we were opposite Times Square. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and the breakfast was a bonus. It is on Hong Kong Island which I preferred to Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and tight”
Reviews.Author: joed3
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location immediately across the street from Times Square. The rooms are really tight.. The bathroom is less than 40 sq ft total with a shower, toilet, and pedestal sink. You cannot turn around too quickly or you will bump into something, The carpets in the halls are very worn and the property is in need of a refresh. The room next door sounds like they are in my room when using their bath or shower - all in all this is a decent low budget hotel solid 2 star to low 3 star. Space throughout this room is at a premium. I'm on a multi-week stay and find this simply too tight. I will hopefully move to a bit roomier serviced apartment nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Holiday Inn Express You Know”
Reviews.Author: prof99skg
Reviews.Content: If you're used to the modern Holiday Express chain in the States, you'll be disappointed in this so-called Holiday Inn Express. The facilities are not at all modern, the rooms are quite small, there are no amenities to speak of, and the "free" breakfast is poor. The one very good thing about this hotel is location--it's right near Sogo and Times Square for shopping and other services in Causeway Bay. The MTR line is no more than 100 meters away, taxis aplenty, but you won't need these for most of the things you need and want in Hong Kong (except for Disneyland or to go to Kowloon). I won't stay here again. For the same price one can get a modern and chic hotel with style--this "Holiday Inn Express" has none of those features.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pumax
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills hotel. The best thing about it is its location. Its right in the center of Causeway Bay. The Time Sq. shopping mall is right next to it with the subway staion right beneath the mall. There are also lots of small eateries around. The room is very small but you have all the essentials. There are free wifi, basic toiletries, hair dryer etc. Room charge also comes with free breakfast (choice of Chinese or Western style). The room also have a sofa bed but I do not think it will actually fit a third person to stay in this tiny room.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for I guess”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLuv
Reviews.Content: Okay I am not a fan of anything less than 4 stars I have to say so my review might be a little bit skewed. It is in a fairly good location, althought Causeway Bay is not my area of choice. The entrance to this hotel is tiny, on a back lane behind Time Sq shopping mall. You take an escalator up to the lobby which is extremely basic. Staff were friendly enough and service was prompt. There is a little dessert restaurant at the base of the hotel that is not part of the hotel I believe. Anyway this little place gets very very crowded at night with a queue out the door. Not exactly a great welcome for guests. The rooms are small and the biggest problem is that the walls are extremely thin. The first night there were some extremely rude and inconsiderate people making a ruckus at 4am. Towels are thin and toiletries are basic. Positives are: Comfy bed, free internet, lots of little local places to eat around the hotel, right next to Times Sq. This is a very basic tourist class hotel. It serves it purpose, but not the right property for me. I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: honeybunch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday Inn Causeway for 5d/4n with a rate of HK5,160. The hotel is infront of Lane Crawford/ Times Square Bldg. The room is quite small that there is no room for your luggages. We had 2 single bed and a sofa bed. The beds are comfortable enough. There is a free breakfast during your stay; choices of American, Vegetarian, Asian. There is an internet room on the lobby which is open 24 hours.The location is convenient if you will be going to Ngong Ping and Ocean Park. Walking around the vicinity of Times Square makes you feel the spirit of Hongkong. Lots of shops, restaurants. Close to MTR. Overall, its a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Food, Good Shopping & Good for 4 people”
Reviews.Author: angiebabytraveller
Reviews.Content: Room has standard twin beds for 2 people and a sofa bed that can sleep 2 kids or 1 person. The breakfast is free at HIPOT with Set menus. It is located at the back of TIMES SQUARE for High End Shopping, walking distance to Lee Gardens for Branded bags and stuffs, as well as SOGO and WTC for Uniqlo and Muji about 4-5 minutes walk....Nice Hotel, no frills but good location. Better than Excelsior or Park Lance where we usually stay.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel in fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelchica23
Reviews.Content: It's always hard for me to assign "circles" in Tripadvisor reviews - what am I comparing it to? I gave this hotel 3 circles because it is good for what it is. It is a no frills hotel in a fabulous location - we paid about $160 or so using Agoda. Initially we were given a smoking room, which we did not want. It was noticeably smokey smelling, so the next day we asked to switch, and the HI Express staff were very gracious about letting us do so! The carpet in that room felt sticky and overall did not have a very clean feel to it. The second room we were switched to was on a no smoking floor and was much better. Everything felt a little more clean than the smoking room & no smokey smell. The beds are pretty comfortable and the linens feel clean. The bathrooms are small but overall pretty clean. The drain in our sink did drain slowly. The location is awesome, right across from Times Square, which has great restaurants including a Starbucks, California Pizza Kitchen, Tony Romos, etc. A short walk to Outback, short walk to Victoria park and the harbour (about 10-15min). The breakfast is okay, a few times our eggs and bacon seemed too undercooked, but the staff is accommodating & friendly if you ask for them to fix it. Western & HK options. Free internet in room, though not wireless. For HK I'd recommend the Big Bus Tour if it is your first time - great way to see the city & you can get on & off at places you are interested in. Overall HI Express is a good budget choice for HK and like I said location can't be beat. Also close to the metro. Our family from the States was also visiting and they stayed with their 2 kids (9 and 10) in a room with a sofa bed. My biggest complaint: super thin towels, felt really old and threadbare, made it feel a little dirty - if they switched out the towels my opinion of the hotel would increase!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, perfect location, a winner overall!”
Reviews.Author: Celiakitty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. We were very impressed with the hotel overall. The room was clean and on a non-smoking floor as we had requested. The bed was comfortable and the room had nice amenities (hot-water kettle, tea, coffee, free broadband internet access, and some toiletries). The bathroom was small, but an ingenious use of space, so it didn't feel cramped. The hotel is clearly aimed at business travelers, with a desk and ergonomic chair rather than a sofa or armchair. The location is fantastic, only a block away from a subway entrance on the island line. It was easy to get to the subway and anywhere on Hong Kong or Kowloon from there. Breakfast was included, and there were several options including Chinese, Western, and even a vegetarian option. The best thing about this hotel was the staff. They were incredibly helpful and friendly. We asked one of the front desk staffers to direct us to the nearest location of my bank, and before we knew it, he had printed a map with walking directions. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hideaway in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: Leeyuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not obvious - there is no driveway and the entry is via a side road. The entry point is at a Chinese desserts shop, there's an escalator to the side and this leads up to the hotel reception. The hotel is smack in the heart of Causeway Bay, Hong Kong's local and bustling district. It's across a street from Times Square, a big shopping complex, and the MTR. There's loads of food and shopping all around, and location is the hotel's strongest point. The hotel is a cheerful, non-traditional hotel that makes your usual hotel look heavy and stodgy by comparison. The reception is light and modern, and staff wear bright green T-shirts. My room was fine. It was understandably small, with lightweight furniture, big glass windows, a working desk and even a sofa! Nothing superfluous, flourescent lighting, a CRT TV, but a bathroom with a touch of luxury in the glass shower cubicle, with natural stone floor. It was cosy and came with free wired Internet access, one of the best features. The free breakfast was more controversial - located in the same building, the cafe was cute and kitschy, with "Good Morning" cotton towels plastered over one wall and various size pot covers on the ceiling. Guests have a choice of 6 breakfast set menus, and frankly, I'd rather not have the free breakfast. Otherwise, this hotel is fine, it's light, breezy and cheerful and a refuge in the hustle-bustle of Cuaseway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: henning_risoy
Reviews.Content: Very good service, good location, free internet in every room, and not too expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: Brisboy77
Reviews.Content: Ok, lets get the one negative out of the way first, the included breakfast at this HI Express is beyond awful. You are provided with vouchers at check-in and the provision of the breakfast is outsourced to one of the restaurants in the same building as the hotel. Day 1, I picked the western breakfast, which was barely tolerable bacon and eggs. Day two I went for the vegetarian option which consisted of something that looked like sloppy gruel (was apparently Oatmeal) and some recently defrosted fruit. The Orange Juice provided tasted a lot like Tang. Later that day I went to a supermarket and bought supplies for the upcoming mornings. Other than that, this hotel is fabulous, great location, great access to transport, although the walk to the Causeway Bay MTR station is deceptively long (about 15 minutues through a number of subway tunnels). The rooms are small but very comfortable, several English TV channels. The staff are very helpful and respond to requests very quickly. There is very good internet room which is free for hotel guests and has around 6 computers, I never had to wait to access one. My 6 night stay cost me just over $900 (Australian), which was great value for money. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone visiting the area and would consider staying here again if / when I next visit HK.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good value for HK with great location”
Reviews.Author: fightinghippos10
Reviews.Content: Express by Holiday Inn Causeway Bay has an excellent location right across the street from Times Square. Hint: if you are eating at any of the restaurants in TS, there is an express lift to 9F accessible by a small door to the left of the Lane Crawford door across from the hotel. Rooms are small, but they do take reservations for 4 (2 adults and 2 children) without additional charge. Our room had a sofa bed that was large enough for our 8 and 11 year olds. There is no dresser storage in the room, so you literally live our of your suitcase. With 2 single beds and the fold out sofa, there was little floor space leftover. There is free wired internet in the rooms and wireless in the lobby. There is no 110V power anywhere in the room; I had to buy a step down transformer for our kids Nintendo DS. Bathrooms are small with shower only and dispensers for all around soap/shampoo. Breakfast is included, and you have your choice of rice congee, scrambled eggs, corn flakes, fried noodles, hamburger, or instant noodles along with juice and coffee or tea. Portions are very large. All in all, this is a good value and great location for HK. Hotel was convenient to Causeway Bay MTR station. Staff was friendly and even recommended some cheaper drop off Laundromats a few blocks a way.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: HenryF09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days. The hotel was exactly what was described and to the standard expected at this type of hotel. There was no baggage porter but plenty of carts were available. The complimentary breakfast was provided in a dining establishment not owned by the company, who provided vouchers giving a choice of 6 plated dishes. Three of which would suit more western tastes. We found the staff friendly and helpful, and a couple of e-mail enquiries we made before travelling were answered satisfactorily by return. Check in is not till 2:00p.m but early arrivals may get a room if one is available,and we were able to be accommodated at 07:00 coming off and overnight flight. The free internet connection is by cable in each room and is fast. We were able to talk to family in the UK by Skype without difficulty. There is a small cyber suite off the lobby for those without laptops, also freely available. The location is first class in the shopping district with good public transport links. The hotel brochure did not make clear that, though the Causeway Bay MTR entrance is in the adjoining Times Square mall, it is a long walk through the tunnels to the actual station. This could prove difficult with luggage. The hotel can provide a contracted, door to door shuttle service to the airport at reasonable cost and cheaper than the Airport Express MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Really value for money!”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeTravellerCY
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms during the Christmas week and had enjoyed our stay there. It is a no frills hotel with fantastic location (just next to Times Square, short walking distance to great shopping belt and food). All rooms are offered with breakfast coupons which occupants can have their choices from 6 different breakfast sets (ranging from local to western) from the cafe "Hipot" at 3rd floor. We tried different breakfast sets on each morning and really enjoyed all. Rooms are clean with complimentary bottles of drinking water replenished daily. Business centre offers high-speed internet access and do not forget to try the popular dessert store (cong sao) at ground level which opens till midnight daily.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: PattiGe
Reviews.Content: I have mostly good things to say about this no frills but great value hotel. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here. I think this hotel offers a convenient location and good amenities for the price you pay. The location is very convenient. It is located in a very busy area with a lot of shops nearby. The hotel is literally across the street from the Times Square mall. The mall provides access to the subway (although it is a 5-10 min underground walk to get on an actual train), has various places to eat and has a grocery store. On the other side of the mall there is a Circle K (convenience store) and a McDonald's (which is open 24 hours). Also there are two 7-11s very close by. The hotel has restaurants as well as vending machines selling snacks and drinks. There is free broadband internet in the room (although I never used) and a computer room with 5 or 6 terminals you can use for free. Breakfast is free and you also get 2 free small bottles of water every day. The staff at the desk are friendly and speak English very well. There is also a security guard in front of the hotel to help you hail taxis. The rooms are very clean. A few reviewers complained about street noise but I thought it was very quiet and could not hear any street noise (I was on the 20th floor). As for in room amenities these include: slippers (new ones every day), toothbrush and toothpaste, tissues, shampoo/soap mix dispenser for shower (bring conditioner and maybe your own shampoo), tv, phone, small and empty minifridge and they even had an adaptor. These are my only negatives: It did not feel like the room heated even when we turned the knob to 30 celsius. Also, the breakfast was free but you had to choose between 6 different fixed options. I did not love the options. Would have preferred more of a buffet. There is no room service, pool or gym if you are looking for these (I was not).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - no-frills and efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bazzer73
Reviews.Content: This no-frills Holiday Inn Express has an excellent location to the major Times Square shopping mall and MTR Causeway Bay station (50 metres). No grand entrance and perhaps hard to get a taxi in that location but the hotel has efficient and polite staff who check you in fast and also aware of most traveler's needs, such as late-check out requests, free set breakfast meal vouchers and concierge support. For a Hong Kong hotel, the room is quite spacious with space for reasonably long desk and sofa. Did I forget to say - free hi-speed broadband internet? YES....no hourly or daily charge like some creamy hotels. Simple CRT TV but all the channels are there and a useful kettle with complimentary tea bags and instant coffee. I love it when the fridge is empty for your own food shopping and who drinks from the mini-bar anyway? Good cupboard space with proper hangers that you don't fiddle with. The only minor complaint is that being in Hong Kong, you will always hear the humming of the traffic and street for a city that never sleeps. Otherwise, the bed is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good central location but traffice noise”
Reviews.Author: IQeye
Reviews.Content: To be honest - I prefer staying on the Kowloon side in Whampoa - Harbour Grand Hotel. But during the course of the year there are plenty of fairs and other reason while the hotel prices are going through the roof. In this case - hands down - this is the best choice you can make. The hotel is no frills or fancy settings but for the money you pay it is a great value. Most important these days - clean rooms. I've stayed there already many times and was never disappointed. Room sizes is standard for HKG clean with TV and free Internet. Location is on the south side of Time Square shopping mall in Causeway Bay. Easy access to the MTR which makes it easy to get around. Sorry never tried the breakfast. DOWNSIDE for me - pending on the room location and floor level you can hear a lot of traffic noise which makes sleeping difficult especially if you are jet-lag.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, free internet and breakfast, super efficient and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Janezhong0102
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Express by Holiday Inn Causeway Bay for almost 1 week and likes it a lot!. The hotel has excellent location and you only need to cross the road to reach time square and causeway bay MTR station. The hotel offer free internet and breakfast! The room functions very well and the size is quite OK. We hold the meeting for around 10 pax in the 7th floor and the service staffs are extremely friendly and efficient. There is a very popular desert shop in the ground floor and it is recommended by the super star Andy Lau. I will recommend this place for my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: GhazalS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Causeway Bay after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. We were a family of three adults on our first trip to Hong Kong. We wanted something near a MTR station so that travelling would be easier. The hotel is very central. The Causeway Bay MTR station is literally across the road. The hotel is loacted at the back of TImes Square and the station is under Times Square so travelling was really never a problem. The staff was very sweet and always willing to help out. The complimentary breakfast was very basic. It is a set menu and has five different options. We had the vegetarian option which was basically oatmeal/cornflakes, fruit and youghurt. But one can order toast separately for $10 as well. Coffee/Tea and juice is also served with the breakfast. Enough cannot be said about the cleanliness of the place. It was super neat and our rooms were always well made when we returned from a tiring day out :) It is perfect for people who're going to be travelling out a lot in the city. It not a posh and fancy place but I believe it is excellent value for money. We also used their airport shuttle to get to HKIA on our return. It cost about $130 per person and was very convenient. Also, because of its location you will find a lot of eating as well as shopping options around. All and all it was a wonderful place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in a brilliant location with excellent staff and facilities”
Reviews.Author: clairesunshine55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in December for my daughter's 8th birthday surprise, my 40th birthday and my mums 65th. This is a brilliant hotel in a fantastic location right next to Times Square. The MTR station is just a short 10 minute stroll. The staff were extremely helpful and responsive to any request. The room was an excellent size, plenty of room for two adults and two children aged 8 and 6 who slept like little logs each night. Very comfortable beds, freshly changed bed linen and towels daily and free bottled water. A free safe and fridge in your room also. The free breakfast was a nice touch and meant that we were able to start each day with a freshly baked crossaint and fried egg. Would definitly stay here on our next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: gafrancomd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the few in Hong Kong that was willing to accommodate 2 children and 2 adults in one room. I chose it because of its proximity to Times Square and the MTR station. And I am so glad I did! The room, although very basic, was spacious, with 2 beds plus a sofa bed. It was also near Ocean Park which was our destination. I would gladly choose this hotel again next time we're in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Still One of the Best Hotel Values in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: FitDude
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel in 2006, and am happy to say my return visit exceeded my expectations. All the rooms now have a mini-fridge, and while the price has risen somewhat over the past 4 years, the rooms are still among the largest in Hong Kong for this class. The bed was comfortable and my room on a high floor was quiet. Do not expect frills or even a bell boy. Just clean comfortable accommodations at a reasonable price in a great location next to Times Square. The free in-room internet makes this an even better deal. If you have stayed at other Holiday Inn Express locations, you will have no surprises here. The maid service did not occur until after 5PM each day which was unusual.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: WilQ
Reviews.Content: Right next to Time Square which is very popular shopping place. 100 meters to the subway network which makes the travel very easy. Room is quite big comparing with some other holidays in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: MamaDep
Reviews.Content: Location was fantastic...it couldn't be beat for the money. Hotel is literally across the street from the Times Square shopping area. Upstairs in the mall, there is a food forum and fine restaurants...all very delish. The Causeway bay areas has shops and eateries will stay open past midnight. Great for overseas travelers still jet-lagged and looking for things to do. We were out and about the majority of the time, so the room was only used for sleep and shower. Location was very important for us. Hotel is simple, no frills.The rooms reminded me of college dorm rooms. Small by western standards, but big enough for 2 adults and 1 young child, and 3 huge suitcases. It could be cleaner, but overall not bad. Extras like bottled waters, toothbrush/paste, and room slippers were replenished daily. We saved the extra slippers to bring home. We did not try the concierge or used the hotel staff much...we knew what we wanted to do, where to go, and what to see. So no comments on the hotel staff. A business center was available with free internet and computers ( we did not use.) No wi-fi in rooms, but free broadband is available and worked fine when we used it. The hotel also provides complimentary use of electrical converter...you can ask downstairs for extras. The set breakfasts were not as bad as per some of the reviews. For Westerners, it may seem daunting, but pick through what you like (fruit, yogurt) to hold you through the morning...then chow on the good stuff for lunch and dinner. Choice of set breakfasts included: A) Congee with cuttlefish balls, man tou (chinese steam bun) B) Bacon, scrambled eggs, toast C) Macaroni soup, scrambled eggs, toast D) Beef satay ramen noodles E) Pasta with sauce (this one was not very edible!) All meals come with tea or coffee, orange juice, and sliced fruit. You will need to request for butter or jam/jelly. We strongly recommend this hotel if you are the traveler looking for a decent place to stay with a great location. Tips: 1) Set meals are popular in HK and a good value, usually offered for lunch. Examples: - California Pizza Kitchen located inside Times Square mall offers set meal for $88 HKD. Includes salad or appetizer, individual pizza or meal salad or pasta, and a drink. - NAHM vietnamese/thai fusion is very good. We ate at the location in Kowloon. Set meal includes choice of salad and noodle dish for $88 hkd. Add dessert for $28 hkd. 2) Hailing taxi from hotel may be a challenge. Go to the taxi stand in front of Times Square where lots of taxi's await. 3) Causeway Bay MTR station is under the Times Square complex. It is about 3+ stories below. It's still a bit of a hike, even with the escalators, but you'll need the walking with all that good food! 4) Check out the supermarkets inside Times Square and other mall/MTR complexes. It's a cultural experience to see the different types of food and small eatieries available. They even offer durian and other exotic fruits. 5) Macau is only an 1hour ferry ride away. The Dragon ferry company is new and very very clean. Try the Portuguese egg tarts while in Macau...YUM!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, clean, comfortable and great value!”
Reviews.Author: mamaanjeli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Causeway Bay where you can walk to numerous restaurants and all the shopping you would like. It is very close to the MTR(underground). The rooms are small but the 4(2 kids: 10, 6) of us was snug but comfortable. The beds have foam mattress which we love (we like firm mattresses). The pull out sofa bed(foam mattress) is comfortable enough for our 10 year old. The rooms are clean. The only complaint I have is there are sometimes holes in the towels and bed sheets. They're clean but just passed their prime. Not a big deal though. They have internet facilities in the lobby area (5-6 PCs) which is very convenient. The breakfasts were basic; but it's free! It's nice to have the breakfast available especially when the kids get hungry early in the morning. We usually go for a snack a couple hours later. CitySuper is located across the street and they have a great "supermarket" and food court (wonderful desserts). Our kids also like to ride the tram and the station is very close to the hotel as well. It has an in room safe, free bottled water, electric kettle, toothbrushes,... A lot of thoughtful amenities which make your stay a lot more comfortable, We were there for 8 nights. Do ask for a higher floor room for better view. I think the lower floors might feel a little claustrophobic as it is surrounded by high rises. It is by no means a luxury hotel, but a very clean and comfortable one. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, smallish room but not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: TravelTiger2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and it did the job fine. It is in a relatively good location, handy to a number of places and transportation options are close by. Breakfast options included Asian and Western offerings - nothing special but more than acceptable. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location Terrible Breakafast ,”
Reviews.Author: PFRANCESCO
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a very nice location and convenient with reasonable price. Quite clean even if the smell of the toiled was really bad. But what scares me and my colleague was the Breakfast that was really terrible , no one including my colleague could eat it. Additionally the staff very unfrendly . PLEASE CHANGE BREAKFAST or do not charge for it.!!

Reviews.Title: “Room size a little small - but hotel staff are very efficient and courteous”
Reviews.Author: Crazvoice
Reviews.Content: Beware of the traffic jams if returning to the hotel by taxi - area around Times Square can get really busy - and the only way to reach the hotel entrance is via a small street right behind times square. Causeway Bay station is a good 10-15 min walk away - not reconmmended if you have large suitcases or small children.Saw another review commented about not being impressed with the breakfast - my family and I thought the breakfast was good - not the usual international buffets that some are used to - but there are 6 different sets which u can choose from - and choice of both Asian and Western is good.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding value/location in HK”
Reviews.Author: Objectively
Reviews.Content: Great value and location in HK. The beds are ok (just not great to sleep on, it's not bad but i've seen better)

Reviews.Title: “It does not get any easier than this”
Reviews.Author: Totti K
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent travelr to Hong Kong, this time I decided to try Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay due to my short visit (less than 24 hours) and need for stay in the vicinity to Times Square. I booked the room through a traveler website and got a good deal (around 80 euros) with breakfast included. Getting to the hotel is extremely easy if you have any knowledge of the public transportation system in HK. I took the Airport Express Train from the airport to Hong Kong Central station (100 HKD and 25 minutes). From there I hopped into MTR to Causeway Bay station (5 minutes) and once I stepped out in Times Square, the hotel was within 3 minutes walk around the corner. Booking went smoothly, my room was in the 20th floor, it was clean with all necessities for a solo traveler. Internet was free and all the electronical appliances worked in the room. Some traffic noise comes to the room, but hey...we´re in Hong Kong. The hotel is within an easy access, it is extremely centrally located and everything was according to their promises. Very smooth and nice experience if you are traveling alone and look for a good, basic hotel in down town Hong Kong. MTR station is also right around the corner. I was very pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value but know what you're getting into”
Reviews.Author: germantchr2
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location and great price. We paid about USD150 per night. There were 4 of us, 2 adults and a 6 year old and a 4 year old. the kids shared the sleeper sofa which was more like a futon and frankly not that comfortable. They are heavy sleepers though so it worked out okay, though we did request an extra blanket b/c it wasn't big enough to share. Free water bottles were great. Hotel was quiet on the room floors despite seeming very busy. The breakfast was dreadful. Easy to get to MTR and Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location at a reasonable price for HK”
Reviews.Author: globetrot73
Reviews.Content: While Holiday Inn Express is no where near luxury, it's clean and efficient. Rooms are small but manageable. Free internet access is great but don't hold your breathe for the set breakfast. One of the best thing going for this hotel is the location. You can't beat setting out of the hotel with Times Square right in front of you and the Causeway Bay MTR station just beneath that.

Reviews.Title: “Many features of more expensive hotels in Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: Jollywa
Reviews.Content: I was an early arrival, due to the timing of my overseas flight. The hotel staff went out of their way to make me comfortable while my room was made ready. Later they changed a large bill for me so that I could have change for the MTR and they gave me directions to the shopping areas I was interested in. The housekeeping staff were fantastic. Since I had been on an overnight flight, I needed a shower right away. They gave me fresh towels as soon as I asked. Later, after returning from a day spent in 35 degree weather, I tpook another shower. I saw a maid in the hall and asked if I could have yet another chaneg of towels. She said "Surely" and was most pleasant about it. So I give the staff "A+" rating all the way round. There is no bell staff, which may be part of the "Express" fpormat at Holiday Inn. But there were small luggage carts which you could use to bring your luggage to the room. Like hotels elsewhere in the city - and in other large cities where real estate commands premium prices (think New York and London), the rooms run on the small side. But there are unique little features that make it seem trendy instead of confining. Located right across the street from trendy Times Square shopping, it is in just the best spot! Plus the Causeway Bay station is in Times Square. In any city, one of the main things I look for is how close the hotel is to the subway. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Ceembee1308
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money when staying in Hong Kong and very conveniently located to the MTR and Times square which is just across the road. The rooms are very pleasant and comfortable. The room rate includes breakfast and Internet which makes the rate even more good value for money. The only problem is that it sometimes difficult to get a taxi as the hotel is located in a one way street and tarffic jams occer at different times of the day but be patient and allow time for securing a taxi which the hotel will organise for you.

Reviews.Title: “does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: dizzydavew
Reviews.Content: Its a holiday inn express in a central location. The rooms are a bit small and there are no other facitlities available. But if you want a cheap, clean room, in a very central location then choose this hotel. After all you are in hong kong you are not going to spend a lot of time at your hotel when there are so many other things you can do.

Reviews.Title: “Its alright”
Reviews.Author: beachchick82
Reviews.Content: I'm in HK for work and due to a tight budget this time round, I've settled on Holiday Inn Express. I'm currently sitting in my room at the desk, typing this now. The room is alright... but the bed is a tad bit too hard for me and the pillow is so flat. don't expect a nice bouncy bed and fluffy pillows here. Thank goodness housekeeping provided two additional pillows when I requested for it. Location is great, though I wish there was a gym. Stay here if you're here to shop only.

Reviews.Title: “good HI Express in nice location”
Reviews.Author: Hammurabiuae
Reviews.Content: Very nice 3 star hotel in a curious location. Whatever you need for one night stay before the flight. I like that the hotel is situated in the second floor of a Building. Rerception very proffesional, room clean , nice bathroom and cheap for Hong kong. Good Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerriegan
Reviews.Content: I'm a priority club member and we've arrived in the hotel around 2pm and yet the 2 rooms we've reserved and pre-paid over the internet aren't ready. We have to wait for close to 20 mins for one of the rooms to be available while the other room requires an hour more wait time. Each of the room we've got has 2 single beds plus a sofa bed. I would consider the room spacious enough. As far as cleanliness is concerned, my friend found a hair inside one of the newly cleaned and folded towels. Amenities: It has free wired internet connection in the room (and free wifi in the lobby). The kettle in one of the rooms that we've booked has a broken light on the power switch. Our package also includes set breakfast meal. There is a good selection of western (bacon and egg), chinese (congee) and asian fusion breakfast (instant noodles with beef in satay sauce).

Reviews.Title: “HIX Causeway Bay, great room, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: HHHSyd
Reviews.Content: I am a member of Priority Club so check in time was measured in the seconds rather than minutes and the room was on club floor. Very nice room. The seat at the desk is the most comfortable I have ever sat at. Internet speed was lightning fast. Awesome view over the city. I slept very well and the air conditioning worked perfectly. Breakfast was basic. Time square area is amazing, the buzz around here is typical of HKG. Long walk through the subway to Causeway Bay station. Lots of great eating places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBustin
Reviews.Content: OK, if you know what to expect from a Holiday Inn Express then this is a great hotel. Very cheap, great location (just opposite World Trade Centre), good rooms, free internet, free hot breakfast, polite staff. As long as you don't go expecting luxury, then you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: junejaps
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has excellent central location. MTR station is right at the Time Square Building. Staff was good and helpfull. Rooms were small but comfortable. AC was effective. Sofa-bed was good for my son who stayed in our room. Free Internet was an add-on. Free Breakfast, though 5 choices were there, had a fixed menu and was not that good. We were 5 persons in 2 rooms and we enjoyed our stay. Airport transfer was chargeable but was on-time and comfortable. Over-all excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A place to crash - good for short stays but not to relax in”
Reviews.Author: drinky_canberra
Reviews.Content: The room was a reasonable size by Hong Kong standards, including double bed, couch, small TV with sat channels, small desk, cupboard with a bar fridge and electronic safe, and reasonable bathroom (see photos). The sink looks fancy but is totally impractical, don't turn the tap on too hard or you will cover the floor with water! We paid around HK$900 per night which was a 'discounted' rate - general online rate was $1150 which is over the top. I think you could find better value, but the location is great (directly opposite Times Square and Causeway Bay MTR station). I think we were on the 14th floor - never heard any noise from the street. Keycard entry to rooms. Facilities are very limited. They have a free internet/business centre and 24hr reception that can help with maps, transfers, tours etc. but nothing else. They will keep your luggage on checkout so you can explore before going to the airport if you like. Getting the MTR to Hong Kong central station or Kowloon to connect to the Airport Express is quite easy if you avoid peak hour, better than paying $130 for their airport transfer which picks up from other hotels and then gets stuck in HK traffic. You can also check-in baggage for your flight at Hong Kong station, and go shopping in Kowloon. Breakfast is terrible! There are six different set menu options but only two (Chinese, English) sounded appetising. Everything made from concentrate or deb. We only ate breakfast the first day and then skipped even though it was included in room rate - I would not pay the $28 they had listed otherwise. There are great places to eat across the road in Times Square and bakery in side street.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - except that bathroom door doesn't have lock”
Reviews.Author: vinpra
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic, service is excellent. The sofa-bed was quite run down. Biggest gripe - bathroom door doesn't have a lock from inside. Checked with the front desk and they confirmed that it's the same across all the rooms in that hotel. Don't know why they decided to do away with the bathroom door locks. Hotel is clean and the location is simply fantastic. You can catch a tram, bus, MTR, cab within less than 2 min walking distance. Breakfast had 6 choices which were ok. For veggies, only cornflakes is available for breakfast. This is supplemented by fresh fruit which was sometimes not that fresh. Stayed there for 4 nights. Overall, decent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwaip
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, just right opposite to time square and you can find MAC , KFC round the conner.....also the MTR is close by.. From the rooms on the higher floor one can get a view of victoria harbour.The staff is good and helpful. The rooms are clean. The morning breakfast is great with lots of options.... Would love to stay again when I am back to Hongkong !

Reviews.Title: “Strictly okay... great location”
Reviews.Author: Naren1309
Reviews.Content: Visited Hong Kong for a week long business + leisure trip... The hotel was strictly okay. The location was great, right in the middle of the shopping district. However the hotel fell short in several departments - The view from the room was pretty bad - overlooking the big wall of Times Square. The rooms are pretty small... The one that was offered initially (on the 28th flr - they call it "no-sofa room") was tiny.. Then we moved to a slightly bigger room on a lower floor. The breakfast was quite a disappointment actually... They have set menus and very little choice - maybe I was not used to being dictated what to eat and in what quantity at hotel breakfasts typically... The choices limited... On the positive side - the rooms were clean and the staff was friendly... Got good tourist tips from the guys at the reception, including using the tram for travel, which is more convenient compared to the MTR, which is quite a long walk

Reviews.Title: “Good "business " Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ryo358
Reviews.Content: Not bad as a business hotel. Located near Times Square and convenience for shopping and restaurant nearby . ( however , a little distant from the exit of the MTR station. Very good as for the system of the free internet and free breakfast(not buffet). Very sorry that there is no bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: debbie_pen
Reviews.Content: Good location and good value as we got a cheap rate on the internet. Only problem was the pull out sofa bed was very uncomfortable with thin mattress. More suitable room for just 2 people. We had a great city view.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, quiet, great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: kaapchick
Reviews.Content: All we needed for a 4 night break in Hong Kong. Near everything, including MTR just outside. Best shopping mall and street market just across the road. Breakfast offers 4 options. The western one was a little boring with just some egg, bacon and toast, but I was more interested in the congee anyway, lovely, so much food I never managed to finish it! With dim sum and fruit, plus juice and coffee. Very good. Free internet, storage for when your flight is later in the day and efficient service. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Simple”
Reviews.Author: d16rr702
Reviews.Content: The entire stay was adequate but not plush by any means. this hotel has really targeted the short stay market. Right behind the famous Times Square Shopping mail. Breakfast was ok, efficiently served. Bed, shower ok, tv small& just a few channels. Fold-out foam couch easily sleep 2 more adults or 3 kids. One annoying thing,.... I asked (and got confirmation) for adjoining rooms so we could check up on the kids. Upon check in, Staff said rooms were adjoining.....or next to each other....confusion starts, I asked for the internal door between the rooms.....no, that's a "connecting room" no more available Now I'm mad but its too late. This is very common in Hong Kong - double and triple check everything ! ! ! !

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay in great location”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiTraveller007
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as I am a priority club rewards member and this was central to the two offices I'll be working out of. This was next to the Causeway Bay/Times Square and right in the middle of an enormous amount of shopping options. The hotel provided free breakfast and restuarant options outside were outstanding. You had street food, high class restuarants, mcd, kfc as well as a grocery in Times Square had a food court where you used to get food from all over Asia in reasonable rates. Only drawback was that the underground rail tracks were quite a long walk downwards even though the station per se was next door. I went during Christmas and Times Square was decked up very beautifully. The rooms were clean, with free internet and the hotel had quite a few restuarants inside including a pizza hut.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nice room”
Reviews.Author: Ling_W
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 4D3N HK trip! It was fabulous! The hotel is located opposite Lane Crowford in Timesquare, very good location and convenient! The room is not too small, very comfortable bed. And also there is free internet service at the lobby. The hotel staffs are very polite and helpful. I will definitely stay this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay with your family”
Reviews.Author: SavioA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Express by Holiday Causeway Bay from Dec 26 th 2009 to Jan 2 nd 2010. The rooms were excellent by Hong Kong Standards, spacious, well designed, efficient housekeeping, superb complimentary breakfast ( Angel & her team were fantastic), courteous & helpful staff, next to MTR station, Nice in house restaurant Happy Face Noodles, Seven Eleven Nearby, We were a family of 3 including my 5 year old son & we thoroughly enjoyed this hotel - Savio Almeida Dubai

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gazfarr
Reviews.Content: good location, although the walk through the subway to get to the causeway bay station platform takes ages if going through times sq. use the tram - its way cooler.

Reviews.Title: “clean,new and best location”
Reviews.Author: Miley02
Reviews.Content: The room is new and clean. The size is small just for a couple and one small kid. The sofa bed is not comfortable for sleeping. The complimentary breakfast is ok but go early coz when it gets late like 9am the restaurant gets full. The staff are very friendly and will give you directions where you want to go and will advise you what is the best transportation to take. Housekeeping was generous with complimentary bottled water. Location, it is right across Times square mall and the MRT station is there...There are other malls near the area like Sogo where i found MAC (cosmetic) which i did not find in Times Square mall.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: islander73
Reviews.Content: For Hong Kong this is a very reasonably priced hotel and an added bonus is the breakfast included in the room rate, plus free internet in rooms. It was clean and comfortable and convenient for transport. The staff were extremely good - when we reported a broken bulb it was rectified immediately, and on requesting some more tea bags these were brought to our room straight away. The reception staff were also very helpful in writing names down in Chinese for us to show to taxi drivers. In fact, they couldn't do enough for us and we really appreciated this. If you're not bothered about views (and you would pay a great deal more for this!) this hotel is a great choice. We had a room on the 28th Floor so no noise, but could be a bit noisy further down close to street level.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Bed”
Reviews.Author: frank_gallagher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice on my way to, and on my way from Oz in May 2007. My first stay was for two nights. Check in was good, very efficient and quick. Staff were very courtious. Room was good, a double bed, clean and bog standard for a HIX hotel. Location is very good, Times Square on the doorstep and easy public transport links. Breakfast was OK in the cafe type place downstairs - WARNING dont eat the so called "western breakfast", bloody awful. Stick with what the locals eat e.g. noodles in soup and BBQ pork in glutonous rice in lotus leaf etc. (when in Rome and all that). My second stay was for four nights. This time I was placed in a twin? after booking a double. Not worth complaining about as I was on my own anyway. When I went to bed in the evening I can only describe the smell of the bed/mattress as an onion/curry type aroma, basically it bloody stank. Lucky for me that I had another bed. I complained the next morning and was told the problem would be sorted. On return to the hotel that night the smelly bed had not been replaced so I complained and asked for a change of room, however the place was full. So I complained again the next morning on check out and moved to the Intercontinental on the Kowloon side. The moral of the story is if you want the service, you have to pay the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SDHEngland
Reviews.Content: I cant fault this hotel at all.The rooms were a good size for Hong Kong standards and the whole place was very clean and tidy.The location was superb,right in the heart of the action of Causeway Bay and very close to MTR station (exit A) which could whisk you off to any part of Hong Kong Island or Kowloon in super fast time.The staff were very friendly and helpfull, especially at breakfast were you were seated and served very quickly.As I booked well in advance I got a great price.We hope to return to Hong Kong in the not too distant future and would make this our first choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a holiday at a beautiful height”
Reviews.Author: surfergirl93
Reviews.Content: we have relations in hongkong. so they were the ones that actually suggested, contacted and the reason we went to visit. it has a great locality across the cross-over from the hong kong side. the rooftop pool was probably it's best feature since you could see a lited view of the sky scrapers after 7 pm. and the best part was, with just a two minute walk from the MTR, anywhere in hongkong was within an hour away

Reviews.Title: “Great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: KatherineMReading
Reviews.Content: Very good location, 3 MTR stops away from the centre of Hong Kong, its skyscrapers and its lively nightlife. The journey on the MTR from Causeway Bay to Central is only HKD5, the equivalent of 50p in November 2009. The MTR station is just round the corner, as is Starbucks, a foreign exchange bureau, a fitness club and numerous shops. The hotel is clean, staff are professional and helpful. Rooms are an okay size and have all the amenities you could possibly need. There is the usual toothbrush, toothpaste and shower cap set and you get complimentary bottles of water every day. There is also a free of charge internet room which is open 24-7. Next door to the hotel is a stylish albeit small bar which charges reasonable (by HK standards) prices. Overall, I had a great stay at this hotel and it did not break the bank (quite the opposite, it is great value for HK).

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place”
Reviews.Author: kwaka58
Reviews.Content: I really can't think of anything bad to say about this hotel. The staff are very helpful, the location is good, and the breakfast menu, although plain, was adequate for the three nights we spent there. The rooms are more than comfortable for two adults and although we were close to the main road side, we were high enough to only just hear traffic noise if we tried. I would have to agree with the comments from some reviewers regarding the distance from the MRT station as it is a bit further than it appears and while it isn't much of a problem when out shopping or sightseeing, I couldn't recommend using the Subway to travel to or from the Airport, especially during peak periods. My suggestion for one or two travellers would be to use the shuttle service, it's cheaper than thieving taxi drivers (even when they're being honest), and less confusing than combining the Airport Express and taxis. Definitely a hotel to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: ZoeGreg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of it's excellent location right next to Times Square, Causeway Bay. The room is very basic, but clean & with everything you need. Nothing special but a great base. We were also attracted by the free breakfast...we found this to be rather disappointing so don't book a stay here based on the breakfast. The western options were either bacon, egg, hash brown, toast, fruit & orange juice with tea/coffee or a green salad with toast, fruit & juice. The quality of the food was average, edible but nothing special. The restaurant where breakfast was held was very cold (a/c overload) & quite depressing! The free internet corner was a great bonus & you also get free internet in your room which I think is really good as many hotels still charge the earth for this service. The room was clean, quiet & didn't have any unpleasant odours which we have found in many hotels that we have stayed in in Hong Kong. The hotel is easy to find, you can either cut through Lane Crawford in Times Square, or walk around the back of the building - the road name is clearly signed. Exit A of the MTR is a bit of a walk but is not a major problem, you could always take one of the other exits & walk to the hotel across the streets. There are lots of great shops & places to eat in this area, plus you are only a few stops away on the MTR from Kowloon & Central. I would recommend this hotel if you are simply looking for a base in great location & are not expecting any luxuries. The room size was quite small, but then this is the norm in Hong Kong where space is a premium!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: taffy20
Reviews.Content: we stayed with a teenager for 5 nights found the hotel excellant value for money on this grade hotel. We found the quality to be slightly better than their British counterparts. The only complaint is that the rooms are a little small when you have to use the bed settee which in fact is more of a futon. Breakfast had a good choice 4 in all two Western and two Chinese. Service very efficient and friendly in both lobby & Restaurent. Four restauants on site all different cuisine. Location ideal, MTR entrance via large, very smart shopping mall that also included every type of restaurant/fast food you could require. Area & hotel spotlessly clean at all times

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much, but the location is great”
Reviews.Author: Brittam
Reviews.Content: I agree with the average or poor reviews here, the customer service is really lacking and the rooms are nothing to get excited about. It is a very cheap basic hotel. However, hopefully you don't spend much time in your hotel while in Hong Kong. The location was nice, easy to walk to anything. Perfect for my first visit. The breakfast is fine for a morning snack, but is not in line with all the delicious food in HK. We had some money sitting out (silly us, thinking we could leave our belonging sitting in our room). The cleaner thought it was a tip and took it. In the end we did give it to the cleaner because it wasn't about the money. I would be extra careful about where you leave any personal items.

Reviews.Title: “It does what is says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Leithman
Reviews.Content: First experience of Holiday Inn Express Hotels and this one was good, as far as I'm concerned. Had rooms on top floor, with views over to harbour and Star Ferry. Breakfast is very good, with enough choice. Breakfast staff very efficient. Rooms a bit on the small side, but everything is there for you. Hotel NOT difficult to find. Get MTR to Times Square Shopping Mall and hotel is on road at the rear. Arriving from East there is a 20 metre banner down the hotel wall with the hotel's name thereon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy access, modern look and feel”
Reviews.Author: NYSAILORGAL
Reviews.Content: This hotel's exterior doesn't do it justice. The exterior is old and worn, like many of the Hong Kong hi-rise bldgs. The interior is beautiful, upscale and modern - with several very nice restaurants, bar and fitness center. Great service all around.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel&great location”
Reviews.Author: Sylarx
Reviews.Content: although the room is relatively small when compared with any normal hotel room, it is located at densely packed business area at the heart of hongkong island. you can easily catch MRT and the old fashioned tram to sight-see the upbeat vibe of modern hongkong. the outstanding features of this hotel are free internet assess via 4-5 computers provided by the hotel at the lobby and the nice&well prepared breakfast of your choice which you must choose one of the 4 choices (2 chinese cousin and 2 american breakfast) oh there're several bars nearly including a western style bar at the ground floor of the hotel. other 2 trendy bars are located on the same street.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what i wanted....”
Reviews.Author: Edsilva
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights at this hotel. There is nothing i can say about this hotel that has not been said by others: Location - We wanted to be 'right in the middle of things' and were not disappointed. Food, shopping, leisure, MTR all on the doorstep of the hotel. Room - Were on the 11th floor in a corner room which overlooked Times Square on one side and had views of the Peak on the other. Many reviews have refered to the 'small' rooms so was pleasantly suprised upon entering. I think the size is more than adequate for a couple. The bathroom seemed to have been adapted for wheelchair users - i dont know if all bathrooms are like this - and was very spacious. The shower enclosure was huge and the shower itself had the pressure of a jet wash!!! Broadband in the room was a decent speed. A nice size fridge in the room came in very handy for us. Breakfast - Had breakfast the first 3 days we stayed there. We both had a western choice each time. Servings were not huge but not tiny either - compared to UK.
