By the 4th morning, neither of us really felt like eggs or oats again so from then on we had breakfast at a variety of nearby places. This is not a reflection on the quality of the hotel food itself as it is decent but it can be a bit hard to stomach the same food each morning. The restaurant in which it was served was VERY cold so a jumper or jacket may be required.... Service/Staff - Every member of staff on reception was polite, helpful and spoke english. Rooms were cleaned well each day. If we left the 'Do not disturb' sign out, we would call housekeeping when leaving the room and was ready upon our return. We took our own iron but there is also an ironing room on the 11th floor for all guests to use. We did get a few item washed using the hotels laundry service and the price was not cheap, HKD40 for a mens shirt for example, but the service itself was good. Overall, i enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn and most definately got value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very functional and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCandT
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn isn't a charming historical hotel. It is however a very clean, incrediably functional hotel in an excellent location only a couple of minutes walk from Causeway Bay Metro station and right opposite Times Square. It also has a business centre with free internet (via computer terminals) which was great for downloading photos and catching up on email. It also has a good airport bus link which is worth it if you have lots of luggage and don't want the long walk changing trains to the airport express. Guests have a choice of four set breakfasts (western and Chinese) which are good but I found the portion size to be a little small (ended up ordering extra sides) Overall this hotel lived up to its rating on Trip Advisor and we would definately recommend to others....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: psethura
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at this hotel - HolidayInn Causeway Bay from Sept 29 to Oct 2nd. My observation a) Excellent Location. Right next to Times Square. MTR - Causeway bay station is walking distance. You need to go underground times square building. Once you are connected to MTR, you can go to any place like Disneyland, Central, Airport, Giant Buddha. since we were travelling all days, getting to MTR was best and we found this hotel to be in great location b) Food - similar to talked about it other reviews of this hotel. You get BF - set menu. A and D are western. B and C - I guess Asian Food. Average. You might get bored after 1 or 2 times c) Pizza Hut is on 3rd Floor. Good and Standard Menu. Only pain I felt is you have to go to ground floor by lift and take another lift to Pizza Hut., even though it is in same building. d) Value for Money in terms of price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: Kento-san
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly situated next to Times Square Mall and LTR Causway station. As well, it had easy access to the network of street cars. The rooms were big enough to accommodate my family of four, but of course more space would have been ideal. Though the breakfast wasn't fantastic, it certainly was decent enough. The one thing I would have liked would have been a swimming pool to get some respite from the heat - then again you can't have everything. The prices were quite reasonable, so would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: allynf
Reviews.Content: this hotel deserves the solid 4-star rating it has on tripadvisor. it is an exceptional value. the rooms aren’t fancy but they are clean, attractive and functional. the rooms are not large; there was just barely enough room for two adults and a 6 year old. when the sofa bed is fully open the desk chair can’t be pushed back. but our 6 year old preferred opening the bed only part-way, which made it seem like a little fort. the breakfast in the restaurant is acceptable though limited to four set choices (two chinese, two western) every day (the menu changes occasionally). free internet was great. we were delighted to find a travel agency in the lobby that could book train tickets, very convenient. the times square mall is across the street, there is a door just to the left of lane crawford that leads to an elevator to the mall. in the basement of the mall is a large food court and a huge western-style supermarket, and there are several floors of restaurants at the top of the mall. there is a 7-11 on the street right behind the hotel (turn right and walk around the block). we really enjoyed a meal at crystal jade dumpling restaurant in the basement of times square, and it is right next to a conveyor sushi restaurant we also enjoyed. for a quick adventure, there is a very cool open air “wet” market with vegetables, meats, seafoods, that can be seen from the windows of the rooms; it is on the other side of the main highway (walk underneath). the market is an easy walk from the hotel, only about two blocks, and a very interesting side trip. the only real downside to this hotel is the distance from the subway: the causeway bay station is two blocks away through an underground tunnel which is an uphill walk toward the hotel. tip: if you take the airport express from the airport, take a taxi from hong kong station to the hotel. we made the mistake of taking the subway, which entailed dragging our bags through the underground passages between the hong kong and central stations, then onto the subway which was crowded, and finally dragging the bags up the two block tunnel from the causeway bay station to times square and around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good familly stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: roulex
Reviews.Content: We stood 6 nights in this hotel last June (2 adults, 2 children 12 and 8 years old) The location is very good. (Ask for a high floor) The family room is however quite small (< 14 sq m): One double bed was good but the other bed was a Sofa bed not comfortable. The breakfast was poor. The staff was kind. The room and the hotel were very clean Rate was reasonable for Hong Kong (500 euros for 6 nights, including breakfast. I Booked 3 month before, at non refundable conditions) I got a virus on the business center PC, via my Sony camera (be careful, no antivirus are installed) I would recommend this hotel for families but no more than 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Helsinki1972
Reviews.Content: The hotel is strategically located in the heart of Causeway Bay next to Times Square and Mass Transit Railway (MTR) station. The staff was friendly, the rooms were nice and clean. Even though, very small. Breakfast was ok. We paid about 65Euros incl. breakfast which is a good deal for Hong Kong. Location is convenient for Victoria Peak, Star Ferry, Shopping. From airport to Hotel : 1. Take the Airport Express to Hong Kong Station (HK$90) and transfer to taxi (HK$55) 2. Take the Parklane Airport Shuttle bus at counter A16 or B16 at the arrival hall directly to the hotel. Frequency is every 30 minutes. (HK$130)

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a near perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Tyrant216
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel twice now -- once in the Christmas of 2006 and once in the Christmas of 2007. Although Holiday Inn Causeway Bay is not the prettiest of the places, it is located in a very convinient place. Located behind the famous Times Square, Holiday Inn is surrounded by shops and restaurants of many different kinds and is walking distance to either subway (MTR), taxi and bus stations that will easily take you around Hong Kong. In the future if I have another chance to come back to Hong Kong, I'd definitely come back here if I can.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic, comfortable and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Dizzeem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great...just what we were looking for in our stay in Hong Kong. This is a Holiday Inn, a place that is clean, comfortable and you can rest up for the night. There is nothing really luxurious about it. Check-in was a breeze, fairly young team at the front desk checked us in quickly and were friendly. The room was just the right size for two people, modern decor. Its not your usual American size hotel room. Clean and comfortable which is all we were looking for. Shower only. The hotel is located right across from Times Square which is partly a upscale shopping mall. Its nothing like NYC Times Square though FYI not that I expected it to be. The walk to the nearest subway is about a good 10-15 minutes walk. It seems a bit long, but its not really as if you take the underground route your are walking through a mall part of the way. You get use to it and its good for people watching. You can get to anywhere from the Time Square subway. We didn’t use our free breakfast tickets. The Vietnamese restaurant in the lobby is great! Try the set lunch menu..good value The food was great, filling and the service friendly and the staff were very professional and on point with everything. There are also a Pizza Hut in the hotel as well as the usual McDonalds nearby that is open 24hrs. Checkout was a breeze, no problems at all. If you are easily pleased and just looking for a comfortable clean place to relax at the end of a long day, this place is it. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent "value choice" in the heart of HK”
Reviews.Author: kwa829
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on 3 separate occasions and will continue to return. The rooms are a bit small (and not a square inch is wasted in the bathroom layout). But, the rooms are very clean and comfortable, and the bedding is akin to what you would find at a luxury hotel. In-room internet is free. Small refrigerator in room (and not a mini-bar, so it actually has room for things). Most rates include a free breakfast . . . the breakfast is good but a bit light. TV includes several English channels. Room rates are very good for what you get . . . you're paying for your room, not for a fancy lobby, a fitness center, or a swimming pool. Exercisers can go over to nearby Victoria Park and use the jogging track there. Location is ideal - convenient to MTR Causeway Bay Station, more shopping than you could possibly want, food options galore (from a street fruit market 100 steps out the door to fast food to casual dining to fine dining). On my most recent trip, I arrived early at 11:30 AM . . . I expected to drop off my luggage, go kill some time, and return later for my room, but much to my delight, they let me in my room at 11:30. Beware that the hotel is very difficult to find, which can be especially frustrating when you're toting heavy luggage around in the sometimes oppressive Hong Kong heat & humidity. So a first-time visitor should be sure to bring a very detailed map of the area with the hotel plotted on it . . . the maps you can get for free in the airport arrivals hall have the hotel labeled in its location, but an even more-detailed blow-up of the neighborhood might help you. The hotel is located along a narrow street behind the Times Square shopping center, and the signage in front is certainly not prominent. Use MRT Causeway Bay station, exit A, and turn left when you get to the top of the last of several escalators. One minor annoyance is the hotel does not give out the usual hotel soap bars and mini-shampoo bottles. Instead, there are two dispensers -- one by the sink, and one in the shower -- that dispense an all-purpose liquid soap/ shampoo. So before you leave on your trip, you might want to grab a hotel soap bar and a small bottle of "hotel shampoo" out of that bathroom drawer where you're storing them. Overall, I was very happy here - great location, very reasonable room rates, clean/ comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Family Holiday in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: santanu_nandy
Reviews.Content: I stay in Holiday Inn express worlwide during business travel and this one located at Causeway bay hong kong did not dissapoint either when I went with my family for holiday. It is centrally located, with the HK undergrowund (MTR) at walking distance and the Ocean Park and all shopping mall are very near. The biggest advantage of this hotel is the rooms. We are a family of four with two daughters of age 13 and 8. In HK finding accomodation for 4 in a room is very difficult. In this hotel you can have that with the sofa cum bed and the rates are fantastic. Besides, the rooms are well appointed with all the standard amenities in a Holiday Inn Express wirh free broadband. Lots of restaurants in the property but try the fraco-vietnamese one on the lobby. All in all great place for a budget holiday with a large family.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Newton_Tony
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and 2 children (aged 12 and 9). We had 1 room, with the children sleeping on a sofa bed. Don't expect too much, but great value for money and very friendly staff. We paid £75 for our room and this included breakfast - which was very good. Superb location in Causeway Bay on Hong Kong island - close to MTR station and Times Sqaure.

Reviews.Title: “The Sweet Spot Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BangaloreTrotwood
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at this hotel for a family vacation that included my wife, our children and my mother. We didnt go expecting too much from the hotel and sure enough we were not dissappointed. In a nutshell, dont expect a luxurious hotel and you would struggle to find fault with the hotel or its staff. It is a great combination of location, cleanliness, speed, comfort; for the price that you pay. To top it all, there is free internet! Highly recommended for people who would want a good hotel to go and explore HK rather than explore the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Skillet_87
Reviews.Content: Best HIX breakfast I have ever had. Rooms were as large as could be expected for Hong Kong. Definitely bigger than the midtown Manhattan HIX. A bit tricky to find the first time if you do not come out of the right Times Square exit. No fitness centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family with young children.”
Reviews.Author: Angelo T
Reviews.Content: Great location. Located in center of activities. You can find local shops and up market shops all around the hotel. You can have the choice of over 20 restaurants and hundres of mall shops in Times Square which is just opposite the hotel, or walk another 50 meters to hunders of restaurants and shops where locals enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay...”
Reviews.Author: Mox_Fulder
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at a Holiday Inn Express and I was pretty impressed. The hotel had a modern look about it and the check in was simple and efficient. At check-in, you were also presented with coupons for their complimentary breakast at their restaurant, W'Entrecote which doubles as a Steakhouse, in the evenings. The room was fair size, clean and had a sofa which was also a pull out bed. The furnishings were simplistic and modern. The bathroom was small but thats all it needed to be. It was clean and there were some ammenities available. I had to get used to using the soap and shampoo from the dispenser on the wall in the shower. That was different. I was pleasantly surprised with the complimentary broadband access in room and it was pretty quick (over 2Mb/sec upload and download) although I have since found out its meant to be complimentary at all HIE chains. For those without laptops, there is internet access at the lobby available. Laundering was also pretty economical when compared to the higher priced hotels. And efficient. I had it picked up the morning and was back early afternoon. The breakfast was nothing grand but it was enjoyable. You had a choice of 3 or 4 set menus ranging from local breafast like congee and dimsum to the usual bacon and eggs. Along with it came some fruits and a glass of orange juice, tea or coffee. Pretty solid to get the day going. In fact, I noticed one guest had both menus that morning. The portions were a little small for most Western guests. The TIme Square Mall is right opposite the hotel (where they filmed a scene for Tomb Raider : The Cradle of Life) and the Causeway Bay MTR is just a short walk further. Transportation from the hotel is pretty good with the MTR, buses and taxis all readily available. Just be aware that peak hour traffic around the hotel can be horrendous. Overall, I am pretty impressed by this hotel. It offers value for money and I think with its modern, simplistic design, its going to be one of my hotels to stay at when I am next back in Hong Kong. The staff were very helpful and efficient, the house keeping was very good, which was more than I had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, good value for money, clean & comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: tda7
Reviews.Content: Grea location, right next to Times Square. Rooms were clean, comfortable and relatively spacious. Well designed bathroom, great shower. Friendly and very patient reception staff. If you're after some fantastic dim sum, try the Jade Garden Restaurant about 5 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: grahamscooby
Reviews.Content: Best price I could find on the internet and great value for money. £85 per night for 4 of us in a room. Location fantastic on HK Island right by the MTR. Clean and comfortable. Restaurants overpriced but so are all hotel restaurants. Breakfast thrown in was fine. Snob value no but for a family of 2 adults and 2 kids trying to do everything and spend as little as possible it was great

Reviews.Title: “As you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Munchkinette
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easily accessible by MRT - excellent for getting about the city - and with lots of shopping and places to eat nearby. The room was clean and a reasonable size. The staff were friendly and efficient - I was especially impressed by the early morning jollity of the breakfast staff! The first two breakfasts were fine, the third pretty horrible. There was free internet at Internet Corner in reception. Really, this was as I would expect for a chain hotel in a city. It was a bit pricey but then this is Hong Kong and the £ is worth very little these days. If you want to see fewer department stores and jewellery shops, turn left from the hotel and head under the flyover and across the road to a street of small meat, fish, Chinese medicine shops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Kirk88
Reviews.Content: We only booked 1 night at this hotel as we were only in HKG on transit. We booked 2 rooms at this hotel, one for 2 people and the other for 3. Having read other reviews we booked a transfer to the hotel rather that taking the MRT. The checkin at 10pm was efficient and rooms were clean and well made up. You cannot expect to much from a express hotel, but it was good enough for 1 night. I wouldnt stay in the hotel for longer than 1 or 2 nights. The location is excellent right next to Times Square which has excellent shopping, and has a 24 hr McD's etc which is useful when arriving late at night. The breakfast is ok, only really sustained us for 1 or 2 hrs. Not enough for a morning of shopping!! They charge you to keep your bags which is ok, considering how cheap the hotel is. They have a private toilet for guests who have checked out but have to leave later in the day which is good. The only complaint is the extra bed, which is made up of 3 sofa matresses put together which isnt the most comfortable. The housekeeping etc was effecient and overall are stay was comfortable and convienient.

Reviews.Title: “Awesomelocation, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mcmug2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Holiday Inn Select during our recent visit to HK. Paid $150 CAD a night including tax / service fees and that included complimentary hot breakfast for two, and free in-room internet access. The hotel is located right next to Times Square (shopping / commercial center) in Causeway Bay and is within walking distance to many great restaurants, subway station, shopping centers, etc. We picked this hotel primarily for its location. We arrived really early in the morning (7am) - hoping to just drop off our luggages, we were given courtesy early-check in instead and was bought to our room right away...which was a very nice touch, esp for someone who just got off an 15-hr flight. The room is a bit small by North American standards - about 160 square feet total (standing shower only) - but this is the normal size in many Asian cities. Bed was clean and all the amenities were readily available. Staff is very helpful and courteous as well. The hotel offers Airport shuttle service at HKD $130 per person, but we chose to take the Airbus (Express Bus to Airport, Route A11) instead - HKD $40 per person. The bus stop is located right on Hennessy Road and the hotel staff will gladly show you how to get there (about 5mins walk). Bus runs every 15-20mins, depending on time of day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: siminnyc
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in 2 rooms at the Holiday Inn Express in Causeway Bay for 11 nights back at the end of February to early March 2008. Being originally from Hong Kong and have close family there, I know the city quite well, and preferred to stay on the Hong Kong Island side, but not in the business district in Central. Causeway Bay is a bustling shopping area, very convenient by public transportation to almost anywhere in Hong Kong. This is one of the prime reasons that we have chosen the Holiday Inn Express. We had a great rate due to the season (right after Chinese New Year). Also we didn't need a hotel bar/restaurant or other extensive amenities because my familiarity with the city. Having said that, the hotel is associated with a 'French' restaurant in the building where a decent free breakfast is served. (The menu had four options to choose from.) It also has has a free internet lounge next to the reception desk. As well as an official Chinese travel agency available to help you book trips to the mainland. One word of caution is that taxi drivers and many locals do not know the location of this hotel, because it is only a few years old, and it does not have a ground level lobby. The lobby is on the second floor up an escalator on Sharp St., behind the Time Square shopping center. However once you figure this out, it's within few minute walk to the MTR station in Time Square, as well as tram, bus, and mini bus stops nearby. The room is small for North American standard, but decent for Hong Kong. We had 2 single beds, and a small couch, a desk, and a decent size bathroom with a glass shower stall. No frill and good use of space. The only compliants are the flourescent lighting is a bit harsh in the room. Also the beds are much harder than what we are used to in North America. The sheets and towels are adequate not deluxe, but the room is cleaned daily, and complimentary slippers, toiletries including toothbrushes and tooth pastes are provided. In room internet is provided for a nominal fee. The rooms we had, had view of nearby elevated freeway, and the adjacent neighborhood and mountain view. Not spectacular, but you do have a view of the real Hong Kong, and sunlight. Again this hotel is a great value, if you are looking to go out, explore Hong Kong, and a decent clean place to sleep in, but not much luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, a location to die for”
Reviews.Author: Miica
Reviews.Content: The room was small, reminded of the cabins on the cruise ships. The roomrate was a bit on the high side, the breakfast experience was very efficient but the food served ridiculous so go to nearby cafes instead. Wouldn't necessarily stay there again inspite of the very happening central Times Square location.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but nice”
Reviews.Author: rlazzara
Reviews.Content: This is a very economically priced hotel in a great location just next to Times Square which is a great place to shop. The location is about a 7 min walk from the Causeway Bay MTR stop. The hotel is clean and comfortable (although a little small and minimalistic but that's expected given the price). In room internet access is included which is a nice bonus. The bed is comfy and a very basic breakfast is included although it's plentiful with a choice of 3 or 4 options. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - ideal for a short stopover”
Reviews.Author: RGYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in Hong Kong as a stop-over en route to Australia. As we wanted to spend most of our time exploring rather than relaxing we decided to go budget rather than pay for frills we would not use. The Express by Holiday Inn did not disappoint. Located a couple of minutes from an entrance to Causeway Bay MTR station (but there is quite a walk to the station concourse itself) and across the road from the Times Square shopping mall the hotel is right at the heart of the vibrant Causeway Bay district. The room was a reasonable size and spotlessly clean. The bathroom had a large shower (no bathtub). Check-in / out was efficient and friendly. The room was modern international and the only way you could tell you were in Hong Kong was by looking out of the window. There is a small 'business centre' with limited free internet access. All told we were pleased with our choice and if you are looking for a good quality, no frills option then this is a hotel certainly worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: El_Scotto
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Express and had a very positive experience overall. As the name suggests, it's a quality hotel but pared down to the basics. Don't expect room service, cable tv or a big screen. The room was cleaned well every day, a basic service you'd expect but rarely seem to get. The free bottled water daily was a bonus as was the simple breakfast - handy when you're in a hurry but not for gourmets. The bed was a good size, somewhere between queen and king with enough room to move around it comfortably. The entrance to the MTR is literally across the street but then you're faced with about 15 minutes of hiking through corridors and escalators under Causeway Bay before you reach a platform - not a great way to arrive with all your luggage. I was lead to believe the Airport Express shuttle bus service would drop us at the hotel but the driver wouldn't take us(why?) so had to catch the MTR at additional cost and hassle. There are plenty of reasonable eateries in the basement of Times Square - Jade Garden is a good option. Genroku Sushi is a good cheap option on the corner but don't take their "bar" sign literally - they had no cold beer the second time I went in so I just left - they still wanted to charge their 10% service charge!

Reviews.Title: “Good standard basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: REDWINE2212
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel, but clean and in a good central location for touring Hong Kong. If all you want is a base place to stay this is definately the place to stay. Tube, bus and taxi stations 2 minutes walk away and located opposite Times Square if you fancy a bit of shopping. Tea, coffee, bottled water supplied, clean bedding and towels every day. Friendly, helpful reception staff. Breakfast is basic (choice of 2 wester meals and 2 chinese) but good standard.

Reviews.Title: “Very highly recommended hotel in a convenient area”
Reviews.Author: Middle_East_Explorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on holiday at this hotel. Its location is excellent, beside the Times Square shopping mall which has fabulous restaurants (we particularly liked the Superstar for dim sum). It's also easy to get to on the metro. It's very clean, modern, and basic, with a young, enthusiastic front desk staff. We thought it was a good value at USD 155 including all taxes and breakfast. There's free internet in the lobby. The breakfast consisted of 3 set options and could be improved, but it was filling and there are numerous places in the mall across the street if one wants a higher-quality breakfast. The bed and the bathroom were superb (although no bathtub) and far exceeded our expectations for a hotel of this class.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: the-masked-avenger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March '06. Basic but "business" type hotel with just the essentials provided. This hotels greatest asset is that it is cheap and located adjacent to Times Square. All round helpful friendly staff (indeed, everyone in HK seems friendly and willing to help!). Breakfast was a weak point though - poor options for vegetarians). A good place to stay in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short city break”
Reviews.Author: epicentre
Reviews.Content: The HI Express Causeway Bay is the perfect choice for a short weekend break in HK to explore the city or just go shopping. Pretty much close to everything. Opposite the subway station and Times Square shopping centre, just 3 or 4 stops from "Central". Beware, though: it's quite a walk within Causeway Bay station to the actual platform! The hotel itself is a solid, modern, clean middle class choice. Perfect if you just need a bed for a weekend/city trip and don't want to miss out on cleanliness and functionality you are used from home. Staff is friendly and efficient. For longer stays you might miss some of the amenities of larger, higher class hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel at a very good location”
Reviews.Author: RMJK
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, right across the Times Square mall and the Causeway bay MTR. This allows it to have easy access to shopping and the food malls. There is also a theatre across the road. The hotel by itself is very decent. The check in is slightly over crowded. The rooms are very clean but small. The bathrooms though are very stylishly done with all the toileteries provided for. The channel selecion in the TV is quite poor and the movie-on-demand dont always work. Overall, a nice clean hotel, with a good location and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Stay”
Reviews.Author: wajym
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on May 5, 2008. About 45 - 1 hr from Hongkong International airport. You pay each way for the bus that will transport you from and to the airport. The hotel is in good shape. The room is a little bit tighter in space compared to the ususal Holiday Inns. Location is very good, lots of restaurants and shopping area nearby. The hotel is behind Times Square where the Causeway Underground Station is. There's free breakfast and the staff at the front desk are helpful. There's a computer room w/ internet just off the front desk area.

Reviews.Title: “It's Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: kathchoo
Reviews.Content: We (3 adults) stayed at the Holiday Inn Express just last week. Good thing about the hotel is the free broadband access and friendly staff. Not so good thing is the sofa bed that was not very comfortable, and the worst, there was a smell on the sheets. The walk from the MTR is quite a distance for the old folks. For the price I paid, I find the overall experience slightly above average.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it again”
Reviews.Author: ILoveIsrl
Reviews.Content: This is second time I stayed at Holiday Inn Express in Causeway Bay. This is perhaps the best budget hotel I have ever stayed at in Asia. Rooms are clean. The service from the front desk to the cleaning staff are polite, efficient and very friendly. It is close to the MTR (underground rail system) and right across the street from Times Square. Restaurants in the hotel as well as restaurants galore across the street at Times Square. This is an expertly run hotel with very well trained staff that go out of their way to help in any way possible. I will be in Hong Kong twice in the next 12 months and no hesitation as to where I will continue to stay. The only and I mean the only downside is that all the rooms at the hotel are the same and as a platinum member there are no room upgrades and no special benefits like newspaper outside the front door every morning....but that is small potatoes compared to the benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: jinapsan
Reviews.Content: This is the place we will stay from now on in Hong Kong. On previous trips we stayed at 5 star hotels including the incredibly posh Oriental and the Ritz-Carlton. We decided to try this hotel for one night since our flight quite late into Hong Kong and we didn't feel like we should spend the extra money for the evening we arrived. Our original plan was just to stay there for one night and then transfer to the Mandarin Oriental Landmark for the following 2 days and nights. After our first evening, we decided to just stay at this Hotel. First of all the location of the hotel is just a few minutes walk from the MTR subway stop at Causeway Bay. Unfortunately it was a little confusing finding the hotel. The exit from the subway was at the Times Square Mall, a huge shopping center in Causeway Bay and the sign for the hotel was quite small and almost unnoticeable. Also the walk from the subway was a gradual uphill climb. In any event once you get to the hotel, checkin is fast and the reception staff very friendly. There is no bell staff so you will have to carry your luggage yourself up to your room. The hotel has 29 floors. The elevators were large and the wait time not so bad. The room we were given was very nice, large enough for 2 twin beds and a double sofa sleeper. The room was very clean and had a nice view of the city. There was a 20 inch television and a nice work desk for use. A plus is definitely the free high speed internet connection. There was no wi-fi in the room but I believe there is one in the lobby area. We were also provided 2 complementary bottles of water each night. There is an in-room safe and cotton slippers were provided. However there were no robes provided. The bathroom was small but the shower had hot water and good water pressure. They provide shower gel and shampoo in a dispenser in the shower. They also provide toothbrushes, shower caps, and sanitary napkins. The beds were very comfortable. At breakfast they provided us with breakfast vouchers. At breakfast they provide you with a choice of one of 3 set meals which includes orange juice and coffee and some fruit. The food was ok if not altogether filling, but there are many cafe's around the area, All in all, this hotel provides great value. While its not meant for people who want to be pampered like crazy or for a wonderful honeymoon, this hotel is great for most of us: a clean hotel with friendly service, free internet, and at a great location in Hong Kong for shopping and as a base to get around the city. I plan to stay here in all my future trips to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice for us”
Reviews.Author: jason416
Reviews.Content: Exactly what the doctor ordered - the location was perfect - rooms were great, staff were friendly and the complimentary breakfast and discount gym passes at California Fitness made for a perfect match. 1) Location - Get off at MTR Causeway Bay and get out at exit "A" at Times Square. The hotel is only steps away and is in the heart of a happening area but had no trouble sleeping. There is a 24-hour circle K just near by for drinks, smokes, snacks, and phone cards 2) Rooms - Nice washrooms, very comfortable but firm bed, soft pillows and great duvet. TV, free internet, alarm clock, safe and fridge 3) Staff - Can't complain; they tolerated my broken cantonese and there were no language barriers. 4) Discount Gym Passes - 98 HKD for a day pass to an awesome gym I couldn't happier with my stay and would definitely stay again hotel is clean, staff are friendly and the rooms are modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nickwaddick
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Holiday Inn Causeway bay with my father for 5 nights in May 2007. The hotel had only recently opened. It was clean, Fresh, great rooms, nice view, outstanding location. this has to be the finest example of a Holiday Inn Express i have been to (And i stay in hotels about 200 nights a year). the staff were fantastic and so helpful. Your 2 minutes from the MTR and a major shopping centre. Breakfast is free as well. Overall a really great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: mumble66
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to let everyone know how pleased i was with this hotel. Good location and importantly for me, clean room and modern clean bathroom. I have stayed at the excelsior before and although rooms much bigger, bathrooms quite dated. Don't think you can beat it for the money. Went to breakfast once - not very good so didn't bother again but staff v helpful, laundry service excellent and if going back and didn't want to spend a fortune (sometimes I go for a spoil and stay at Peninsula) I would def go back.

Reviews.Title: “No Pretense - Great Value For Money- For the Initiated and Independent!”
Reviews.Author: MouMou
Reviews.Content: NO PRETENSE - GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY FOR THE INITIATED & INDEPENDENT! Location – Excellent ================ 1. Located next to Times Square. Exit A from Causeway Bay MTR station. Walk around the Salvatore Ferragamo shop corner and it’s right there (on your left). Word of caution: The walk to exit A is a fairly long one. So you have a lot of luggage, my advice : Take the airport shuttle bus. It stops right in front of the hotel and the frequency in every 15 mins. 2. Easy access to shopping (Times Square, WTC, Sogo) and eateries in the vicinity. Lobby/Reception (1st Floor) ====================== 1. Take the escalator to the first floor, and you will see the modern looking reception. Check-in is efficient & business-like. 2. Forget about bell-boys, concierge (the reception doubles up) . This hotel is for the self-initiated & independents. 3. There is an internet corner with broadband access (accessible by guest card). It is like a study room, complete with stationery. You can have free internet access here. 4. There is also a China Travel Service (HK) Ltd travel desk, and an eatery, Dining Room on the same floor. 5. 3 lifts serve the guest rooms (the rest serve the restaurants within the same building) and the wait is very manageable. Other Self-Service Options ===================== 1. Laundry / Dry cleaning : You will have bring your laundry bag and complete the laundry form (from your room) and bring it to the Housekeeping Dept between 7:30 to 9:00 daily. Pick-up is at 19:00 to 23:00 Daily. 2. Ironing : Ironing Room is on the 11th Floor 3. California Fitness: If self-service is insufficient exercise for you, the hotel has an arrangement for you to work out at California Fitness….at the prevailing going rate. 4. Meeting rooms : 2 connecting rooms for small size functions are available on the 7th floor 5. Vending machine is located at lobby level & there is a 24-hour convenience store within walking distance. Room ===== I have a double bed, non-smoking room on the 28th floor (there are 29 floors in this hotel) overlooking Times Square, and I could even see the sea from my bay windows. Access to the room is by room card which doubles up as activating all the lighting. 1. The rooms are good size by HK standards and even compared to hotels from the Dorsett chain. The room is basic & well-maintained. The fluorescent lighting made the room look more functional rather than cosy. Likewise, the study desk light is a florescent too! The well-maintained carpeting lends some warm touches to the room. 2. Mattress is firm with lots of plush pillows. The sheets are of acceptable quality & clean. 3. There is a study desk with PVC-bound swivel chair and you may use the LAN cable provided by the hotel to connect on the internet on your notebook. The speed is slower than Tokyo’s but is fast enough. I had some teething problems connecting but once the server was re-set, it’s just great. It’s even free. I experienced staying at the Four Seasons, Shangri-la, Conrad & Hyatt. Not only was I charged exorbitantly for internet connection, there were not as fast. They even provide an adapter plug in the room…..how thoughtful! 4. The only stationery provided is a hotel notepad & pen. Don’t expect any envelopes or any hotel stationery. BYO. 5. There is a hotel safe & torchlight (next to your bedside) and a LCD alarm clock. 6. Good size TV, with remote control. A total of 19 channels for you to choose from : 7 Chinese, 8 English (including BBC World, CNBC HK, AXN), 1 Spanish, 1 German, 2 Japanese. 7. Telephone : Has voice-message facility. Only 1 is available on study desk, not beside your bed or the bathroom. Corded (not cordless). 8. Cloths hangers/Closet/Drawers : The closet is small sized and there are no drawers in this closet or room. You find an empty fridge in the closet as well (strange). To sum it, closet space is manageable with a 2 or 3 days stay. There are clothes hanger hooks to hang your cloths. 9. Luggage rack: A foldable luggage rack is provided. 10. Bedroom slippers : They even provide bedroom slippers! That’s a really nice touch! 11. Other nice touches : Hairdryer at study desk, kettle jug, cups & sachets of Chinese tea and coffee. 12. Air-conditioning/Heater: There is no heater option at all. The weather was freezing cold this Feb 2008. When I called up housekeeping, the hotel immediately provided me a portable heater which was very effective (both solutions & heating me up!) 13. Sofa : There is a sofa-bed set in my room. Staying alone in this double room bedroom is definitely not optimal! Bathroom & Toiletries – Well designed & functional ======================================== 1. Soaps/Shampoo take in the form of a dispenser, at the washbasin & in the shower. If you are particular about conditioning your hair, bring your own conditioner. Bring your own moisturizer too.. this is not a 5-star hotel. 2. Other toiletries provided : Disposable toothbrush with toothpaste, shower cap. 3. The shower is good size & sufficient power in the water jet. If you like baths, sorry this is not the hotel for you. 4. Bath towels : Clean and well-maintained. 5. WC: the door of the bathroom doubles up as the door to lock your WC. I applaud the optimal use of space & design. 6. There is no power point for shavers nor disposable shavers provided. BYO! Breakfast – Very order, organized & adequate! ==================================== I was curious after reading all the poor reviews about the breakfast. You get your breakfast coupon/s upon checking in. Breakfast is served from 7am to 10:30am at W’s Entrecote (a steak restaurant from noon onwards). In typical efficient HK-style, you get to choose from 4 set menus : A, B, C, D. A & D are western options, offering croissants/bacon. B & C are oriental options offering congee or noodles. The breakfast turned out to be much better than I expected after all the poor reviews. I enjoyed the century egg/lean meat congee a great deal, the fried mini- spring rolls, the deep-fried mini pork bun, followed by fruits. Tea/Cofee & orange juice is included all the sets. Sure, it is for venue for feeding the masses but I would not likened it to being in a canteen. It is served in such an orderly & organized fashion that, if you are a late-morning person, you never have to end up eating leftovers (most hotels like to serve breakfast buffet style). CONCLUSION ============ I would pay the extra (compared to Dorsett chain or the YMCA) and stay here. Yes, even on business, this hotel is adequate enough. My type of hotel. Getting straight to the point and doesn’t make a pretense of its limitations (which are few). How often to we use the swimming pool, anyway, if you are a single or a lone business travel? I paid slightly over HK$1000 for my stay. If you can get the room for less than or equal to HK$1000.00, I would say, “Take it! you are getting your money’s worth!”

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Sfran10536
Reviews.Content: As a family of 4 (2 teenage sons) we were travelling on holiday around Asia and Hong Kong was our first destination. We were then to travel in Singapore and then on to Bintan, Indonesia. As you can see this holiday, was not going to be cheap and having been to Hong Kong on business I knew hotels in Hong Kong were very expensive and very few family rooms available. We wanted to splash out on better accomodation later in the hoilday. I had stayed at The Excelsior Hotel on Causeway Bay previously so I knew the area. Also I knew that our 5 days in Hong Kong would be spent seeing the place and not staying in the hotel. Therefore, I took a chance and booked this hotel on the web and what a good decision it turned out to be. Rooms : We had a large family room with a double bed, a single bed and a bed settee and a big bathroom that was actually layed out for disabled use. The rooms were clean, but basic. Really they were typical of a Express Inn / Travelodge in the UK, so we were happy with this. The location is on Sharpe Street around the back of Times Square, Causeway Bay and a hint and tip is to make sure you look for the Times Square underground exit at Causeway Bay. It saves walking with your cases on streets full of people. There were advantages to the hotel for my boys; free access to the internet by the hotel reception and there was a Pizza Hut in the hotel accessed via a seperate lift. The breakfast : This was basic but adequate. There was a choice of three types, either cereal and toast, cooked English or Asian. Staff: Were friendly and very helpful. So in summary, a great value hotel that will save you a fortune right in the heart of Hong Kong Island.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Shewolf76
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the trip advisor rating ( was #44) and we are glad we did. I was on a bit of a budget, yet wanted somewhere clean and central. We booked it directly via the Holiday Inn website. Check in was smooth and the staff were very courteous. The rooms were not large but they were extremely clean and all the ameneties were new. The beds and sheets were quite comfortable and a "set" breakfast was included with 2 asian and 2 western choices. They were basic but filling. The location is unbeatable, being just 2 minutes away from the MTR and located next to large shopping complexes, some food and clothing outlets open until midnight! The causeway bay area itself is safe with many restaurants. My husband and I managed to get a therapeutic massage 10 minutes walk away at midnight! Perfect way to end a sightseeing day! The staff were very helpful. When the airport shuttle tried to tell us that they were unable to pick us up due to a protest in the area, they negotiated for them to send another bus ! While it is not a luxurious establishment, I would definitely stay there again for its service, location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: jglin
Reviews.Content: We were here on Christmas. Although you would be disappointed with the hotel exterior, you would be surprised that the rooms are actually value for money. The bed is comfortable and we could see the peak from our room. As for breakfast, try the burger or the porridge but give the noodles a miss. Locality is great as we are just opposite Times Square, Causeway Bay. MTR station is very nearby and if you want to visit the wet market (selling fresh live seafood and vegatables), it is just across the road at Sharp Street. I suggest you visit the wet market and see how the locals bargain while buying seafood. Very interesting sight!I love watching the live seafood jumping in front of you. Walk further down after the market and come to Morrison Street. Turn right and you will see a tea house named kiong Kee. They sell fantastic roast goose (almost as good as the famous Yong Kee at Central but at only a fraction of its price). The stall beside the tea house selling 'yu dan' (spicy fishballs) is a must-try too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value - free internet access a real bonus”
Reviews.Author: oz-elf
Reviews.Content: This was the cheapest and best hotel I could find online, its not 5 star but its nicer than I expected and the location is fantastic, right across the street is Times Square and the MTR train station which will take you everywhere if you want to travel further afield. We were happy with the breakfast, its a super fast service and they'll even let you pre-order and pick up your breakfast if you need to. We stuck with the bacon & eggs each morning of our 3 night stay, this included toast, coffee and orange juice - all included in the room price we paid. Our only complaint was the flooding bathroom but I'm sure they'd have fixed that now - we told them about it the day we checked out. Front desk staff were pleasant - and yes they have free internet access, an internet roonm on the same floor as reception which is accessed by your room card - and we travelled through 8 countries on this trip and this was the ONLY hotel that offered free internet - really handy when you want to email friends & family to let them know you've arrived safely etc. No complaints here :)

Reviews.Title: “Convenience location and Nice room”
Reviews.Author: Sm1l3y
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an economical hotel but wanted a good location. I read a couple review about this hotel and then decided to give it a go. I didn't have a high expectation for this hotel but once we arrived, we know that we would love the location. Breakfast was better than we expected as there were 4 set menu to choose from and available for take away. However, only 2 elevators are available to take guests to the hotel room, the other 2 or 3 elevators were used to get an entry for restaurants etc. Overall it is still a good hotel to choose if you have a small budget and still want a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value for HK”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveller168
Reviews.Content: I have been going to HK for more than 15 years, and more than 3 or 4 times a year. So safe to say that HK is like a 2nd home to me. Over the years, I've seen HK hotel prices go through the roof, so if you're on a budget (which in HK means around US$100 to US$150) but want to stay in the more relevant areas, you'd have to stay at the older hotels. Not anymore! The Express usually goes for HK$830 to less than HK$1000, if you book early enough through their web site. It has all I need for a HK hotel, nice clean decent sized room, clean bathroom, good location and free internet. True, breakfast is tiny, but hey, you're in HK, the city of food. There is a Pizza Hut in the hotel, and the Entrecote steak restaurant is not bad too. Of course, at the Times Square Mall, you got the food court, plus some more food choices at the basement, as well as 4 stories of dining at the top of the mall. I stay here most of the time when I travel alone, reserving stays at the Peninsula or Sheraton or Conrad or Island Shangri-La when I'm with my wife. It's the best value to come out of HK in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location but bad Breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: RachaelD
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasnt already been said before. The hotels location is smack bang in the middle of the action on Hong Kong Island. The Times Sqaure shopping mall is spitting distance from the hotel entrance. For all those designer shoppers out there it is paradise for you. Theres plenty of resturants and bars within walking distance. In terms of getting to other parts of Hongkong there is a MTR entrance, and yes it is a bit of a walk underground to the platform but its not that bad and its cool down there. You can get from the hotel to Tsim Sha Tsui in about 20 mins using the MTR. We arrived at the hotel really early and didnt expect to be able to check straight in, but the front desk were overly helpful and managed to get a room cleaned straight away so we could get some much needed sleep. We had a doulbe room with sofa bed, it was more than big enough for us - lack of wardrobe/ shelf space but we managed. It was clean, tidy and peaceful. But who ever spends too much time in their room when in Hong Kong. Breakfast is not that nice if you go for the english option - theres a Starbucks on every corner so you can get a caffine fix there. All in all 9/10 you get what you pay for and a little more. Rachael UK

Reviews.Title: “Don,t ever think to stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dorayon
Reviews.Content: i stay in this hotel fro 3 night. We can not sleep .The room is too small, the fire alarm often scared us. The hall to the room often smell, after we take shower the water ofter f loaded, maybe the price is cheap, but we recommended you not to stay here, it's not worth it. And the last but not list, the breakfast is not very good

Reviews.Title: “very affordable and nice”
Reviews.Author: van023
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at express by holiday inn from Aug 31 to Sept 3. The hotel was small but just right for us. The location is perfect because it's right in front of Times Square and there is an MTR station at Times Square too. Though this hotel is located at north side of HK it's not hard to go to places because there's a bus stop near the hotel and a shuttle stop in front of the hotel and MTR station is just few steps from hotel entrance. I love the hotel interior because it is modern and clean. I will definitely stay at holiday inn express when I go back to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful”
Reviews.Author: whipflash
Reviews.Content: Small and noisy rooms, unfriendly staff but with a great location. This hotel was not purpose built but adapted into an old office building. My stay there was very uncomfortable and was made unforgettable by being woken at 1 am by the fire alarm. Calling reception was useless as no-one answered so I ran down 27 flights of stairs only to be told that it was a false alarm. I did however smell smoke on the 7th floor. I checked out in disgust.and will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: meghangw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently with two friends. We were really surprised at the quality of the room. I had stayed at Holiday Inns before, but this was certainly one of the nicest. The beds were comfortable; however, the "sofa bed" (a foam-fold-out mattress) was not that great. The bathroom was really nice, and the shower was top-notch! I was also impressed with the housekeeping service. We had fresh towels and sheets every day. She even tidied up a little for us, and removed old water and wine bottles. The location of the hotel was phenominal. It was a short walk to everything: MTR, Starbucks, shopping, bus stop, good restaurants, 7-eleven. You couldn't ask for a better location. I used to work for a 5 star hotel, and this hotel's service seemed a lot greater than what the 5 star hotel offered. I will most certainly stay at the Holiday Inn Causeway Bay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location but.....”
Reviews.Author: Jolie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay for 3 nights end of May. The experience we had is way beyond anything we ever had. LOCATION The location of this hotel is fantastic. It is right behind Times Square, all more the better to shop! And the metro entrance (note entrance) is just a few steps away, but you actually have to walk quite a bit of a distance to get to the metro station itself. Restaurants and cafes are plentiful around so no need to go hungry, in addition CitySuper (one of the local supermarket) on the lower ground of Times Square is open till late. CHECK IN Super speedy, although they stuffed up my reservation. We actually booked through the hotel website for a double non-smoking room but they gave us a smoking room instead. Did managed to changed it but we were told that we were lucky that there one room available for us...(as if it was our fault) ROOM Not much expectation, given this is Hong Kong. But this room is definitely a match box. The double bedroom is squeezed against the wall, and there is a wardrobe of some sort but definitely only have space for one piece of luggage. The other went under the table. I've stayed at Novotel Century and New World Renaissance, and this room is a quarter of their size. Mind you, the smoking room was much bigger. But hey, at HKD780 per night, can't really complain. And being on the 22nd Floor, we didn't hear much traffic and had a fantastic view of the building next door. BATHROOM This is the highlight of our stay. Yes, it very clean by normal hotel standard but Holiday Inn Express is relatively new. Obviously the bathroom is small, or I should say shower room as there isn't a bath. The best bit is that when you flush the toilet, it floods up along with some interesting things.....(YUCK). They did fix it eventually but definitely puts us off completely. OTHERS They do have ironing board on another floor if you wish to do some ironing. And as per any hotel prices laundry was expensive so we took it to the local laundry about 5 minutes walk who washes and fold our bundle of clothes for only HKD28. Overall this is a budget hotel with a fantastic location. Do I really want to stay here again? I think I might pay a bit more next time I am in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: wanderluster123
Reviews.Content: We found a great rate from the hotel website. We were expecting a typical Holiday Inn Express, but were pleasantly surprised as the hotel seemed brand new (even though its been around for a while) and had modern amenities. Its more akin to a boutique hotel rather than a large hotel chain. The location is excellent, not on a busy street in Causeway Bay, and right behind Times Square. I would definitely stay here again. You have breakfast and internet included in the room rate. Great deal in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dmills1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 5th, 6th, and 7th. Check-in was handled efficiently. Room and bathroom were adequately sized. Breakfast choices A, B and C were no different than any other hotels continental breakfast where you get the same choices everyday. We attempted to eat at the Pizza Hut in the hotel one evening, but the place was full and there where about 25 people waiting for tables... we retreated back to Times Square and ate at the McDonalds. We also ate at Tony Roma's on the 12th floor at Times Square. The hotel is across the street from the Times Square shopping center and the MTR station... although it is quite a walk underground to the trains.... We paid just over $100 USD per night for a room which I though was quite reasonable for the area.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel alot”
Reviews.Author: dodgyme
Reviews.Content: Nice big clean modern rooms with views of HK if you are high enough. Great location. Decently large bed, well designed bathroom. I would recommend this hotel if I was going back to hong kong. Can be a bit of a queue at breakfast if you go at around 9 o clock.

Reviews.Title: “Great+”
Reviews.Author: Rogerncook
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews about this hotel, I was a little apprehensive especially as this was to be the last hotel we stayed in on our trip round China and Australia. I had no reason to be worried – it was, considering the price, great. First of all the breakfast – which has had some criticism from other reviewers. Yes, you have a choice of Breakfast A, B or C. We chose breakfast ‘A’ and got a really excellent plate of fried eggs, hash browns, bacon and toast. The waiters happily brought round refills of coffee and orange juice. I am a Priority Club Platinum Card holder, so I know all about Holiday, Express, Crowne Plaza expectations. I have to say I have been charged £15/US $30 for many worse Holiday Inn breakfasts than I was given here for ‘free’. The room was smallish, but still fine for a city where space is at a premium. We eat an evening meal in the Chinese restaurant that is in the hotel, but independently operated – this too was very good and reasonably priced. My only advice would be to ask for a room away from the lifts/elevators. They seamed to have a very load ‘ding-dong’ bell when the doors opened. This I am sure would be audible inside the guest rooms near to the lift/elevator. Free internet was also a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Manage your expecations!!! (For those who have knocked this hotel)”
Reviews.Author: BalUK69
Reviews.Content: Booked last december and I was a little worried about reviews I read in certain travel websites. But I trust holiday inn express as a brand and went ahead. Got a great rate from Asiarooms.com The rooms are small but very adequate and more importantly ...... Really Clean. I loved the fact that the hotel was right behind times square and walking distance within everything in causeway bay. 10/10 location. Not much of a concierge and breakfast was lame. But Hey if you are a proactive traveller, you wont get better value for money than this hotel in Hong Kong, im definately booking again. Free internet was a big bonus. Just to clarify the service. I arrived really early from Australia, and basically they really looked after us by giving us the next available room. It was ready for us at 9am. They had no obligation to do this for us... but they did..

Reviews.Title: “Don't know why they don't charge more”
Reviews.Author: madridtripper
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, Holiday Inn Express Causeway Bay is great value for the money. LOCATION: The hotel is a 2-3 minute walk to the Causeway Bay metro station. Being in HK, a ton of restaurants and shops are within a few minutes' walk, including the Times Square Mall (it's literally across the street). ROOMS: The rooms aren't huge, but they aren't as small as other HK hotel rooms (like at the Kowloon Hotel). We stayed in two different rooms and both came with a small sofa and desk. Both rooms were very clean and the AC definitely worked! The showers were cool, with a stone, non-slip floor. SERVICE: Very polite and speak English well. INTERNET: Free service via 4 terminals in a side room off the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: jetsettergal
Reviews.Content: We prefer to stay in this hotel whenever we are in HK since it has an excellent location, relatively cheap, plus FREE breakfast and Internet use. Granted the rooms are cramped, there is no "service" to brag about, and the lighting in the room is flourescent...still, it is definitely worth what you pay for it. We love the fact that even up till midnight, Causeway Bay is still buzzing with activitiy, and you can actually step out of the hotel and find decent food to eat no matter what the hour. Another plus is the wonderful shower head that is a sure treat after a tiring day...One thing though is that we wish they'd have more english channels in their lineup for cable TV. All in all an excellent stay and worth going back to...

Reviews.Title: “It is an average hotel with a good size room”
Reviews.Author: nocorptax
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights, after spending 6 nights at Eaton Hotel on the Kowloon side. The neighborhood is different, we tried all 3 types of public transportation here, the tram, the bus, and the MTR. We also found our favorite childhood snack in this area. But I believe we got a better deal with Eaton in terms of types of hotel and services. The breakfast is, just breakfast. While Eaton has the LCD TV, this one has the old fashion TV sitting on the desk taking up the valuable working space. We had requested a room away from the elevator, but got a room facing 6 of them. Luckily it was not noisy. But had it been during the summer vacation time for kids, I believe it will be a busy and noisy area. I might stay here again only if I can not find another better choice. The room size is good, and it comes with a sofa. It would be logical to have the LCD TV hanging on the wall, so every one can see the TV from the sofa or bed. The walk to the nearest MTR entrance is short, but the actual boarding area is a LONG walk in the tunnel. I prefer to walk outside to do some sightseeing, and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: BlackberryAddict
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of our china trip - with the kids. A bit cramped with the four of us, but excellent value for money in Hong Kong. And close to the metro, which was very helpful - buy an Octopus card, and you can use it to get round the city very easily. Use the Times Square metro exit to get to the hotel - go up the escalators, turn left, then right , and there's the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but a great hotel anyway”
Reviews.Author: josmon10
Reviews.Content: After being pampered in Mainland China, this hotel came as a breath of fresh air. No bellboys taking your luggage or bowing as you walk by, but I was a bit sick of that by then. Instead, what you get is a brand new, clean, comfortable and pretty big room by Hong Kong standards. And for the first time in HK, from the 2 windows of my corner room in the 22nd floor, I managed to see some of the most famous skyscrapers like the Central Plaza and a bit of Victoria Harbour. Another first was having 4 PCs available near the reception desk 24 hours a day, so I didn't have to worry about the closing time of the Business Centre. And free of charge! Apart from the small café where breakfast is served, the hotel has no restaurants of its own, but there are 4 or 5 in the same building, like Pizza Hut, which offer some discounts for hotel guests. And the other plus is the location. So far I had only stayed in Tsim Sha Tsui, but Causeway Bay is so much better. No tailors harassing you, and safe to take a walk until at least midnight. Besides Times Square is opposite the building, and the underground, taxi stand, buses to Stanley, etc, are all close at hand. All in all, a nice surprise and a hotel I'll be returning to frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: sleepyh
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel as part of our honeymoon. It's main benefits are the location and the cost - we were hard pushed to find anything that came close in Causeway Bay. It wasn't flashy and we didn't have a huge room or great view, but how much time do you spend in your hotel room in a place like Hong Kong?! The breakfast wasn't bad with two western and one chinese option, the reception staff were really helpful and there were four PCs with free internet access. The safe in our room gave us peace of mind and the bathroom was really well designed to make the best use of space. This wasn't a particularly memorable hotel but it ticked all the boxes and allowed us to spend lots of time exploring this amazing city

Reviews.Title: “A-ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: cookie-sweetie
Reviews.Content: booking your hotel in hong kong is cheaper through a travel agent than online. We got the holiday inn express in causeway bay for 110 US dollars a night online is about 150 US dollars. We stayed there for 5 days. Upon checking in, we requested for a non smoking floor but all the double rooms are occupied. the receptionist said that she wll transfer us on a non smoking floor the next day in the mean while, she ask the housekeeping to spray our room to get the smell out of our room. The next day, they did heed to our request : ) the room is ok for hong kong standards. It's new and it is clean. although they dont provide and replenish toiletries everyday. True, there is not a lot of english channels- i think there are only 3 or 4 channels- MTV, National Geographic and CNN- as far as i can remember but we were put during most of the day so not a problem for us. The free internet section was a plus. They have pens, pencils and paper provided for you. The breakfast have less selection- set a, b and c everyday. On our fourth day, we were gonna puke on the same menu, good thing, they vary the selection a little. Upon checking out, there was no hassle at all. Although you have to pay 30 HK dollars for any luggage you wish to leave if your flight is at night. we have no problem with that because we made use of the in counter check in of the MTR- airport express. Over all our stay there is A-ok!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: CSSAUS
Reviews.Content: Being self-employed & a frequent traveller to HK, I'm conscious of what my expenses are. In my opinion this hotel provides all the basic necessities that one needs when travelling. The room is well lit, and there is a very adequate work desk layout with the power points easily located on the desk itself (no having to hunt around on the floor for them). For business purposes there is free in-room internet access, something which is quite rare in the much larger and more expensive hotels in Hong Kong. The bathroom is very modern, clean and functional. Enough has been said about the breakfast and the suggestion is to head across the road in the Times Square building where you can find all sorts of eateries. Starbucks is up the escalator to the first level where you can coffee and the usual muffins. Location is excellent, right on top of the MTR station with the entrance found inside the Times Square building. It's a great hotel if you're looking for budget accommodation. If I wasn't travelling on business and on vacation with my wife, I would probably not stay here and head for one of the more traditional-style hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benandtrix
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong, SAR- Holiday Inn Express Date: Feb 02 to Feb 05,2007 I Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, and upon checking in i could sense that this hotel service is not that good. and upon our check out, we try to leave our baggage at the concierge since our flight will be late in the afternoon, the front desk clerk told us that we have to pay HK$30.00 per piece of luggage we are leaving. Gosh! this is the first time a hotel collecting baggag storage fee. I will definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: kspace
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay on Hong Kong side after last 2 trips at Kowloon hotels, and the Causeway bay area seemed the best choice for shopping and convienences. Early booking 2 months before our trip helped to get a great rate at US$105 since there was a big telecom conference the week we were there. Rooms were very clean and all the rooms face north towards the street and Times Square. There are no rooms facing the other way since the building is very narrow, and all the rooms are the same size, so don't worry about getting a smaller room. The bathroom door was a great trick. When opened, swing it all the way and it clicks to close off the cistern/WC, so that more than 1 person can use the bathroom and still maintain privacy. As another review pointed out, the sofa bed actually opens out as cushions on the floor. It may be a bit small and hard for an adult, but as we were 2 adults and a 9-year old child, this arrangement suited us just fine, instead of having to pay more for an extra bed. Breakfast as described is rather limited, but I don't think there are any other hotels in the same district and price range which throw in the breakfast. I suppose it is good for business travellers and those who are short on time, but if you have the time and inclination to explore, there is a great Cantonese cafe/teahouse about 7 min walk away (Tsui Wah) on Cannon Street.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and other impression”
Reviews.Author: smallman
Reviews.Content: As pointed out by xiantraveller in previous review, this is definitely a budget accomodation but hey look at it this way - you only paying a comparatively small amount of money for a place to sleep and shower so why not. The Good - location, location, location It is at the back of Time square which means you can literally shop till you drop up to eg. 11 pm. The MTR is just across the road. Trams, buses, taxi a plenty nearby. You can find restaurants, shops nearly everywhere you walk. The Bad - it is in the middle of Causewaybay which means you have to put up with the crowd, exhaust fume from the buses, polution, noises etc. If you are looking for a relaxing holiday like away from all the hustle bustle stay somewhere else. But if you are a shopaholic then you will be right at home. Other things to consider - No bell boy to move your luggage upstairs or downstairs. No refreshment in the fridge. No bath tub. you do have a decent size room. you do have free breakfast and public internet service but $3 for each page you print. you don't have a harbour view as such. you have your own safety box in the room. you can have 2 single beds or one double bed in the room and a sofa, a working TV, hot movie is extra, no charge for inbound calls but outbound cost you $5.

Reviews.Title: “Great time there..”
Reviews.Author: easysabre90
Reviews.Content: I just returned to Santa Clara,outside of San Francsco, today.I stayed in the hotel for 3 days. I had a great time and the hotel is very busy. Staff is very courteous and any unreasonable requests are handled with thorough efficiency. You can breathe on Times Square from your hotel window which is very convenient.Shopaholics will feel right at home and this hotel tops my list on my next trip to HK. Victor G. D.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: It is a limited service hotel. No room service (food). No bar in the fridge. But just about everything else. Writing desk, TV, radio, hairdryer, laundry service, ironing room, breakfast included in room price, 3/4 restaurants/bars in the hotel building. You are not going to pay a ridiculous sum of money for a marble entrance with a waterfall or two large ballrooms at this hotel. Although it is not pricey, in a way it is trendy classy. The staff all wear a smart casual uniform in green and white. They look cool. The wait staff all wear those thick lensed eyeglasses and have animie haircuts. And what's more they are efficient. The rooms have been featured in style magazines. Why? Because they are fresh. Nice colours, crisp linen bed covers, tasteful artworks, expensive tap fittings and so on. Each room has a very interesting bathroom door feature. Whilst the rooms are not speacious - you do get a king sized bed with at least a metre gap to the sofa bed. There is space in and around the desk. You get one wardrobe, some shelving, a fridge and a luggage rack. An ironing room is available on another floor if you want to freshen up your clothes and the hotel does offer a quick laundry service. There are 3 breakfast choices - Western, Asian or vegetarian. Location is superb - directly opposite the Times Square shopping complex. MTR is in the Times Square. Definitley would recommend to anyone loking for a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Crash pad - no frills.”
Reviews.Author: zippy10k
Reviews.Content: I stayed with two friends in a triple room here for 3 nights at the end of August 2006. Bit of a much-of-a-muchness really... The room was clean and had quite a nice shower room. It would have been fine for two but was a bit of a squash for three and we ended up with luggage stuffed under the desk. The third bed was a sofa bed which had a piece of wood running where you put your head and didn't make for a particularly comfortable night. The service was fine, the safe broke and they sorted it out reasonably quickly although we had a few communication problems with the housekeeping staff (they didn't speak much English, we didn't speak a word of Cantonese, but then that's our failing really). The location is good, right next to the massive Time Square shopping mall and next to an MTR entrance although it was a 10 minute walk once in the station to actually get to the trains. Now the subject of breakfast! There were 3 options while we were there, which were the same every day. I was quite prepared to try the Chinese style breakfast, although the thought of noodle and pork soup first thing in the morning didn't appeal to my friends. This was pretty nice. The sausage, ham, egg and toast option looked and tasted like a bad airline breakfast. The third option, which admittedly none of us tried, was salad and baked beans (!!?!!) and seemed a slightly bizarre combination for us Brits. So if you don't mind noodles it's fine, otherwise get a croissant in the mall across the road. We never had to queue for breakfast although when we left each time the queues were quite long. All in all it was fine as crash pad with no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: cs2thecox
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 2 friends for 3 nights at the end of August. The room would have been a good size for 2, but was a bit of a squash once the sofa bed was folded out for the third, but I guess that's always to be expected when you have 3 people in what is fundamentally a twin room! Everything was clean, the shower was nice and powerful, and they give you free toothbrushes. We found the staff helpful, and they let us settle the bill the night before we left so we didn't have to worry the next morning when we were running for a flight. The breakfasts were a little bizarre, but for free you can't complain! Two pieces of toast, scrambled egg, orange juice and tea are enough for me... I ignored the rather suspect-looking sausage and ham. My friends went for the Chinese option - soup noodles and steamed rice with pork. Apparently really tasty but not something I could face for breakfast. The one criticism would be the vegetarian option... salad with baked beans. Hmm. Might be best to ask for the English breakfast with no ham and no sausage! Great location just round the corner from the Times Square shopping centre, lots of other shops, and the MTR station. And, booked direct through Holiday Inn's UK call centre, worked out at just under £25 pp pn. Bargain. Would recommend to young travellers, bargain hunters or those on short stop overs, but probably not to my parents!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YLC
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Holiday Inn Express, only because we were looking for a stop over hotel in Causeway Bay area. It turned out to be a great hotel in an excellent location, right next to the Times Square. We took the Airport shuttle bus where is located at B1 in the airport to our hotel. It cost HK400 for two people/round trip. Make sure to stop by at the airport information desk and ask for coupons if available before you purchase the tickets at B1. We found that it was more convenient for us to take the shuttle bus than the Airport Express, because the Bus drops you off right at the door. With the Airport Express option, you still have to walk to the hotel with your luggage after exit the station. Although you will save more time by taking the Airport Express, the cost is about the same. There are many clean and inexpensive restaurants located on the underground level of the Time Square shopping center. When you get out of the hotel, walk through the park garage where is right across from the street of the hotel, turn right at the end of the garage, and then take the escalator to the underground level. The hotel staff was very pleasant. I agree with the review below that the hotel room, power showers, and the room conditions are just great. Be sure to take advantages of the free internet access in the hotel lobby. We actually liked the breakfast. Because the food in HK is so inexpensive, we really did not want to fill our self up early in the morning, so we enjoy the good food for the rest of the day in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room”
Reviews.Author: EmmaB79
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Hong Kong and a friend suggested staying in Causeway Bay. It turned out to be a great location - transport links are excellent and the hotel is very close to Times Square station and the trams. Time Square shopping centre is also great, with lots of great restaurants. The hotel was great too – our room was large. We had a large double bed and sofa. It was also quiet, so we could get over our jet-lag. It was air conditioned, newly decorated and the bathroom was excellent too. If only all hotels had power showers like this one! The hotel also has free internet access for guests in a room near the reception desk. Only downside was the breakfast - not worth bothering with at all. However, this is a Holiday Inn Express, so I knew there wasn’t a proper restaurant. All in all, we would stay there again and would recommend it to friends.
